zh-CN: （1）新闻测试集。
en-US: ﻿ ( 1 ) news test data .

zh-CN: 研究：上下班同路有助婚姻美满
en-US: for a good marriage , travel the same way to work

zh-CN: 分享梦想与雄心有助于营造成功的婚姻关系。
en-US: shared dreams and ambitions can help make a successful relationship .

zh-CN: 上下班同路也有助于婚姻美满，尽管这听上去不大浪漫。
en-US: but it seems the rather less romantic link of a shared commute can also help .

zh-CN: 一项研究称，上下班同路的夫妇感觉更幸福。
en-US: married couples are happier if they travel to work in the same direction , says a study .

zh-CN: 专家认为这让夫妇们感觉到自己在生活中拥有更多共同目标。
en-US: experts believe it makes couples feel they share wider goals in life .

zh-CN: 他们说，该研究成果建议新婚夫妇考虑选择让两人能上下班同行的住所，而不是选择位于两人工作地点中间的住所。
en-US: they say the findings suggest newlyweds should consider choosing a home that requires them both to commute in one direction , rather than one located at the midway point between their two work places .

zh-CN: 香港中文大学首席研究员艾琳•黄说，“夫妇们的婚姻满足感可能取决于他们上下班的时候是否同路。”
en-US: ' couples ’ marital satisfaction can depend on whether they commute to work in the same or different directions , ' said lead researcher irene huang , from the chinese university of hong kong .

zh-CN: “走向同一个与特定目标相关的方向（如一同上下班）可能与共同实现更多总体目标联系起来。
en-US: ' physically moving in a particular goal-relevant direction ( e.g. commuting to work ) might become associated with more general goal-related concepts.'

zh-CN: 他们引用了法国作家，《小王子》的作者安东尼•德•圣-埃克苏佩里的话：“爱不是彼此凝视，而是一起注视着同一个方向。”
en-US: they quote the french writer antoine de saint-exupéry , author of the little prince , who said : ' love does not consist in gazing at each other , but looking in the same direction together . '

zh-CN: 艾琳•黄和她的同事们发现，上下班同路与较高的婚姻满意度之间有明显的相关性。
en-US: huang and her colleagues found a clear correlation between commuting in the same direction and higher marital satisfaction .

zh-CN: 他们还发现这种相关性独立存在于其他诸如结婚年数、子女个数、收入水平和花在上下班路上的时间等因素之外。
en-US: they also found that this link existed independent of other factors such as number of years married , number of children , income level and differences in actual time spent commuting .

zh-CN: 此外，这种相关性也不取决于夫妇们是否有时会一起离家上班，这意味着这种相关性并不是因为夫妇们一起上下班时有更多机会交谈。
en-US: furthermore , the link did not depend on whether or not couples sometimes left home for work together , meaning it was not due to having the chance to talk together while commuting .

zh-CN: 第二项调查在香港进行，有139位平均年龄42岁、平均婚龄13年的已婚成人参与。
en-US: the second survey involved 139 married adults in hong kong , who were 42 years old on average and had been married for an average of 13 years .

zh-CN: 与在美国进行的第一项调查结果相似，其上下班与高婚姻满意度之间的相关性也独立于其他相关因素。
en-US: it showed a similar correlation to the us results , which also held independent of other relevant factors .

zh-CN: 拨开中国经济数据迷雾
en-US: parsing china's conflicting economic data

zh-CN: 最近这些天，阅读中国的经济新闻可能会扭伤你的脖子。
en-US: you can get whiplash from reading the economic news coming out of china these days .

zh-CN: 某个月，怀疑论者高举虚弱的工业产出数值，惊呼“中国经济即将崩溃！”
en-US: one month the skeptics hold up weak industrial output and exclaim , " crash ahead ! "

zh-CN: 下个月又轮到乐观主义者大肆庆贺中国GDP增长7.7%这样的向好数据。
en-US: the next month , the bulls are back celebrating things like china ' s 7.7% gdp growth last year .

zh-CN: 中国经济前后摇动的最新迹象是近期的一波股票抛售潮。
en-US: the latest sign of china's economic to-and-fro was the recent stock selloff .

zh-CN: 过去几个月，中国股市下跌了15%，跌幅是其他新兴市场的两倍，似乎是股票交易者发出的恐慌信号。他们担心中国可能无法抵御即将到来的挑战，包括收紧失控的信贷，大规模的经济转型，也就是摆脱对庞大的基础设施项目的依赖，走上一条更具可持续性的经济发展之路。
en-US: chinese shares dropped by 15% over the last couple months , doubling the decline of other emerging market shares , in what seemed like a panic signal from traders worried about china's ability to weather upcoming obstacles , including tightening runaway credit and undergoing a massive pivot away from huge infrastructure projects to more sustainable economic growth .

zh-CN: 过去六个月的中国经济报告时好时坏，但它们总体上在暗示，乌云就在前方。
en-US: the reports have been back-and-forth for the past six months , but overall they hint at some dark clouds ahead .

zh-CN: 本文试图逐一解析各项经济指标的近期走势，一窥中国经济目前的状况及其未来的发展方向。
en-US: here , then , is a breakdown of the indicators' recent history , where the economy is now , and where it could be headed .

zh-CN: 半年前，中国的采购经理人指数(PMI，这是衡量一国经济实力的重要指标之一)冲上16个月以来的最高点。
en-US: six months ago , china's purchasing managers' index , or pmi , a key gauge of the economy's strength , was hitting 16-month highs .

zh-CN: 经历了两个令人失望的季度之后，中国经济似乎正在趋稳。
en-US: the economy looked to be stabilizing after a couple disappointing quarters .

zh-CN: 来自PMI的好消息提振了市场的信心，促使人们相信习近平主席和李克强总理领衔的中国新一代领导集体有能力应对猖獗的影子银行体系和银行超额放贷问题，同时又不至于扼杀经济增速。
en-US: the pmi news boosted confidence that the country's new leadership in president xi jinping and premier li keqiang could tackle rampant shadow banking and banks' excess-lending without killing growth .

zh-CN: 当时的主要忧虑似乎是，美联储削减国债购买规模的计划到底会对中国经济造成多大的伤害。
en-US: the chief concern back then seemed to be how much the fed ' s cutback in bond purchases , or tapering , would hurt china's economy .

zh-CN: 紧跟在这份好心情之后的是一直延续到去年年末的房价疯涨势头。
en-US: the good spirits were followed by skyrocketing housing prices through the end of last year .

zh-CN: 去年12月份，北京和广州的房价同比上涨了近30%。
en-US: prices rose nearly 30% year over year in december in beijing and guangzhou .

zh-CN: 与此同时，一些三四线城市的房价开始下跌。
en-US: at the same time , prices in some of the country's smaller third- and fourth-tier cities fell .

zh-CN: 中国的房地产市场现在出现了一道裂痕：最富裕的城市仍然红红火火，而一些小城市已经开始趔趄。
en-US: there's now a break in the market : china's most affluent cities are still booming while smaller ones are starting to falter .

zh-CN: “房价持续下跌意味着银行将出现更多的不良贷款，它们将不得不进一步收缩贷款规模，”清华-布鲁金斯公共政策研究中心代理主任、中国人民大学经济学教授陶然这样说道。
en-US: " if they continue to drop , that will mean banks will have more nonperforming loans , and they will have to further contract lending , " says ran tao , acting director at brookings-tsinghua center in beijing and professor of economics at renmin university .

zh-CN: “如果最终出现信贷紧缩，房地产泡沫可能就会破灭。”
en-US: " finally , if there's a credit crunch , the housing bubble may burst. "

zh-CN: 这一幕可能会率先从小城市开始，然后逐渐向大城市蔓延。
en-US: that could start in the smaller cities , and then make its way to the bigger ones .

zh-CN: 房价上涨对任何其它经济体而言都是经济基本面健康的体现，但在中国，飙涨的房价意味着，房地产市场崩溃的几率正在与日俱增。
en-US: rising real estate prices can be healthy for any economy , but in china they're rising so fast that the odds of a crash are growing with them .

zh-CN: 今年1月份，一位未透露身份的接盘人（很有可能是政府）救助了一个规模高达5亿美元、名为“诚至金开1号”的风险投资产品。
en-US: in january , an unnamed source -- most likely the government -- bailed out a $500-million risky bank investment called credit equals gold no. 1 .

zh-CN: 虽然中国避免了信托行业的第一起违约事件——根据上一次测算，专为有钱人寻找高息投资机会的中国信托业已经发展到大约1.6万亿美元的规模——但它并不是一个鼓舞人心的消息。
en-US: while china averted the first default in its trust industry-- an industry that last measured around $1.6 trillion in size and is tailored for rich people searching for high-interest investments -- the news wasn't encouraging .

zh-CN: 其他潜伏在暗处的不良投资是否也面临着类似的命运？
en-US: what does it say about other bad bets lurking in the shadows ?

zh-CN: 它是不是让人联想到贝尔斯登旗下那两只于2007年年中崩盘、暗示其他金融机构存在同样问题的对冲基金？
en-US: was this reminiscent of two bear stearns hedge funds blowing up in mid-2007 , which intimated problems elsewhere in the financial system ?

zh-CN: 二月初，中国的PMI指数下降到了50.5，抵达6个月以来的最低点（大于50说明经济在发展）。
en-US: in the beginning of february , china's pmi fell to 50.5 , a six-month low ( above 50 signals growth ) .

zh-CN: 就在这些数字出炉前，中国政府刚刚发布消息称，中国2013年GDP增速为7.7%，依然令人印象深刻。
en-US: the numbers came just after the news that china posted still-impressive 7.7% gdp growth in 2013 .

zh-CN: 这个PMI数字非常可怕，因为它预示着，随着中国收紧信贷，同时逐渐摆脱对出口的依赖，中国经济有可能严重放缓。
en-US: the pmi number was scary because it portended a potential deep slowdown as the country tightens credit and shifts away from a reliance on exports .

zh-CN: 谁都知道中国最终需要调整经济发展模式，但这个过程不一定会顺利。
en-US: everyone knows china eventually needs to shift its economy , but that process won't necessarily be smooth .

zh-CN: 不断下降的PMI指数就是在提醒人们注意这一点。
en-US: the falling pmi was a reminder of that .

zh-CN: 最后来谈一谈新兴市场在过去几个月的股票抛售浪潮：仔细审视相关数据之后，德意志银行发现了一个发人深省的问题。
en-US: and about that emerging markets selloff the past couple months : deutsche bank took a closer look at the figures and found something revealing .

zh-CN: 分析师重点研究了中国H股指数和A股指数之间的股价表现差异（H股在香港上市，由全球投资者广泛持有；A股在大陆上市，不对外国人开放）。
en-US: the analysts focused on the difference between the stock performance of china's h share index and a share index -- the difference being that h shares are listed in hong kong and widely held by global investors , whereas a shares are listed in the mainland and not open to foreigners .

zh-CN: 他们发现，在截止2月中旬的两个月，A股指数仅下跌了6%，而H股指数则下跌了16%。
en-US: what they found was that during the two months leading to mid-february , the a share index fell only 6% while the h shares dropped 16% .

zh-CN: 这些分析师总结称，股市并不是在刻意惩罚中国，而是在惩罚所有其他新兴市场时顺带着打压了一下中国。
en-US: they concluded that the stock market wasn't punishing china , but throwing it out with all the other emerging markets .

zh-CN: 他们写道，“对H股指数与A股指数跌幅相差10个百分点这一现象唯一有意义的解释是，全球投资者正在不加区分地抛售新兴市场股票。”
en-US: they wrote , " the only meaningful explanation for the 10% under performance of the h share index is the indiscriminate selling of emerging market equities by global investors . "

zh-CN: 从许多指标来看，中国经济目前起伏不定，但股市多少让我们对世界第二大经济体的前景抱有一丝乐观情绪。
en-US: the stock market offers some optimism for the chinese economy facing plenty of other ups and downs .

zh-CN: 助你拓展社交圈的6个好办法
en-US: 6 tips for expanding your social circles

zh-CN: 无论你是想拓展事业，还是扩张朋友圈，你都需要学习-甚至是掌握-交友技能。
en-US: whether you ’ re interested in advancing your career , or having a new group of friends to go out with , you need to learn — and perhaps master — the skill of making friends .

zh-CN: 在这篇文章中，我想要与大家共享6个扩展社交圈的招数。
en-US: in this article , i would like to share with you 6 tips that will help you expand your social circles .

zh-CN: 与社交达人来往
en-US: connect with connectors

zh-CN: 有一个拓展社交圈的好办法，那就是与活跃于社交圈的人来往。
en-US: a great way to expand your social circle is to connect to someone through whom you ’ ll meet many other people .

zh-CN: 那些“社交达人们”正是在脸书上有着成千上万粉丝的人群，他们会随心所欲地举办派对，在别人眼中他们也总是成群结队。
en-US: those “ connectors ” are the types of people who keep friends on facebook by the thousands , host parties whenever they can , and always seem to be with a large group of people .

zh-CN: 通常来说，这些人都非常开放，也比你想象中的还要容易接触。
en-US: oftentimes , these are very open people and are easier to connect with than you think .

zh-CN: 也许他们没有时间和你发展深刻的友谊，但他们却热衷去结识更有趣的朋友，使其融入自己的圈子。
en-US: they might not have the time to invest in a deep friendship with you , but they love to get to know more interesting people to add to their circle .

zh-CN: 不断认识不同的人
en-US: meet new people constantly

zh-CN: 不断认识新人是拓展交际圈的极佳习惯。
en-US: a great habit to have is to always be meeting people that you can add to your circles .

zh-CN: 现实中，并非所有你遇见的人都会成为朋友，也并非你现在所有的朋友都会永伴左右。
en-US: in reality , not all the people you meet will become your friends and not all your current friends will be around forever .

zh-CN: 这也是我为何总是说如果你没有结识新的朋友，那说明你的朋友在减少。
en-US: this is why i always say that if you ’ re not making new friends , you ’ re actually making fewer .

zh-CN: 我建议你到一个能够让你轻松、舒适走上前去并向大家介绍自己的地方。
en-US: i recommend that you go to places where it ’ s easy and appropriate to walk up to anyone and introduce yourself .

zh-CN: 理想情况下，那个地方的人同时也得开怀迎接新朋友。类似的地方就有贸易展览、开幕夜、联欢会、文化或慈善活动、讨论会或茶话会。
en-US: ideally , you need to go to places where others are open to meeting new people as well. examples might be trade shows , opening nights , galas , cultural or charitable events , seminars , and talks .

zh-CN: 塑造布施者的价值观
en-US: establish yourself as a giver of value

zh-CN: 当参加众人聚会时，你得“做钩”。
en-US: when meeting lots of people , you have to “ hook ” .

zh-CN: 没有什么会比布施者的态度更能钩人了。
en-US: nothing hooks better than having a giver attitude .

zh-CN: 首先，仔细倾听别人，并换位思考；由他们的视野去观摩世界。
en-US: first , listen really to what they say and imagine if you were them ; see the world through their eyes .

zh-CN: 然后，诚挚地分享你的故事、故人，或及时给对方所说所讲提出建议。
en-US: second , be willing to share stories , contacts , or quick advice on what people are talking about .

zh-CN: 与人初见面，依据的是那套心理学原理，那会直接决定对方是否愿意再见你。
en-US: when you meet new people , there are some psychological principles that determine whether or not they’ll want to meet you again .

zh-CN: 这是在潜意识里产生的作用。
en-US: this works on an unconscious level .

zh-CN: 其中最重要的一条原理就是给予或索取态度。
en-US: one of the most important principles is the giver/takerattitude .

zh-CN: 若对方感到你只在乎自己，那么你们不会有下文。
en-US: if they sense that you only care about yourself , connection isn ’ t going to happen .

zh-CN: 展现给予态度有两种方式。
en-US: you can portray a giver attitude in two ways .

zh-CN: 第一种是认真倾听对方，看对方所看的世界，基于对方的故事和情况来给出你的观点。
en-US: the first is about really listening to what they say , imagining the world through their eyes , and giving them your opinion on their stories and situations .

zh-CN: 第二种是证明你愿意与之分享类似的故事，或者介绍别人伸出援手。
en-US: the second way is to prove that you ’ re ready to share similar stories about what they ’ re talking about , or introduce them to someone who could help them .

zh-CN: 致力于当地社区活动
en-US: commit to a local community

zh-CN: 促进社交生活最快速的方式之一就是参加社区活动，加入到那个有你想与之交友的社团里。
en-US: one of the fastest ways to boost your social life is to get involved in a community that has the type of people that you want as friends .

zh-CN: 这个社团得在你们当地区域，并且至少每月举行一次或更多的聚会。
en-US: this community should be in your local area and should hold social get-togethers once a month , or more .

zh-CN: 而你需要做的就是找一家你中意的社团，这可以在meetup.com网站上找，然后向团里的人提供帮助。
en-US: what you do is find one that you like , maybe on meetup.com , and offer your help to the people who run it .

zh-CN: 即便他们并不怎么需要那份帮助，但绝大多数都会接受；重点是他们乐意看到你心怀兴趣。
en-US: they’ll most likely accept , even if they don ’ t need that much help ; they’ll just be glad you ’ re interested .

zh-CN: 这招很有用，因为它能让你遇见不同的人，并能树立你作为给予者的价值观。
en-US: this works great because it makes you meet everyone , and because it establishes you as a giver of value .

zh-CN: 保持定期联系
en-US: reach out to people on a regular basis

zh-CN: 如果你想要维持社交圈的人脉，那么保持联系是至关重要的一点。
en-US: staying in touch is vital if you want to keep your social circles alive .

zh-CN: 你需要追上新朋友的步伐，还要关注老友的动态。
en-US: you need to follow up with the people you just met , and catch up with existing friends .

zh-CN: 其中的挑战在于我们往往会分心，又因分心而忘记，接着再生悔意。
en-US: the challenge here is that we tend to get distracted and forget about it , and regret later on .

zh-CN: 要解决这个问题，你可以每周关注一次，也就是每周固定花一小时去打电话、发短信或留言。
en-US: to solve this problem , you can create a weekly ritual , where you spend only one hour calling , texting , and messaging people .

zh-CN: 这只需你在日历上标出特定的一天，每周执行一次。
en-US: just mark on your calendar a specific day and time , and do it every week .

zh-CN: 最好的日子就是周二或周三，因为能让你和朋友为周末好好计划一翻。
en-US: a great time to do it is tuesday or wednesday , as it gives you the opportunity to make plans with people for the weekend .

zh-CN: 提前了解自己想要结交怎样的朋友
en-US: know the kind of friends you want in advance

zh-CN: 在投资时间去交朋友前，做一个小小的策划。
en-US: before you start investing more time on making friends , do a little planning .

zh-CN: 试着弄清楚你想要与什么样的人出去闲逛。
en-US: try to figure out what kind of people you want to hang out with .

zh-CN: 不妨列出一些对方的品质、性格特征或与你对味的兴趣爱好，不要犹豫，即使在这点上比平时多点野心又怎样。
en-US: list out a few qualities , character traits , or interests that you like , and don ’ t hesitate to be a little more ambitious than usual .

zh-CN: 这个方式之所以重要是因为它能让你的大脑迅速分辨出对方是否与你特别对味。
en-US: this is important because it allows your mind to quickly tell if a person you meet could be a great fit for you .

zh-CN: 女性出轨的五大现实理由
en-US: 5 realistic reasons why women cheat

zh-CN: 说到男性，大多数人都会觉得他们骨子里是欲望动物：眼神游离不定，还想要拥有多位性伴侣。但是，说到出轨，也许男女比我们想象得更加“平等”。
en-US: as far as stereotypes go , a wandering eye and the urge to jump into bed with multiple partners seems to be built into a man's dna , but when it comes to cheating , the sexes are created more equally than we think .

zh-CN: （比如克里斯汀•斯图尔特）心理学硕士、两性关系专家蕾妮-李给出了以下5个女性出轨的理由。
en-US: ( cough , kristen stewart , cough. ) renee lee , a relationship expert with a masters in psychology , dishes out five reasons why women cheat .

zh-CN: 正在经历转变
en-US: going through a transition

zh-CN: “如果正面临毕业，到了某个年纪，失去至亲或感情状态更进一步，女性会开始反思自己。”蕾妮解释道，“即使这些是她想要的，比如订婚或者毕业，但这些转变还是会在内心激起波澜，她们不禁会思考应该何去何从，或者她自身的状态。这些变化带来的不快会使人一时冲动去另寻他人来分散自己的注意力，让自己暂时逃避目前的处境。”
en-US: " if it is graduating , turning a certain age , losing a parent or advancing the relationship status , women become introspective , " explains lee. " even if it is something she wants , such as just getting engaged or graduating , the transition can stir up an array of emotions about where her life is going or where she is in it. the discomfort of change can trigger an impulsive desire to find someone to take her focus off the change and be a diversion for what she is going through. "

zh-CN: 2、觉得不够被重视
en-US: 2 . not feeling adequately celebrated

zh-CN: 我们都有过这样的情况：“工作上得到晋升，组织了一次募捐活动，又或者给20人聚会准备感恩节晚餐，男性常忽略的一点是：没有好好赞扬妻子的成就。”蕾妮说，
en-US: we've all been here : " may it be getting a promotion , organizing a fundraiser , or making thanksgiving dinner for a party of 20 , men often make the misstep of " not complimenting their partner's achievements , " lee says .

zh-CN: “女性总是希望她们的丈夫能给予她们更多关注，为她们的成就而自豪，并感谢她们的付出。所以，当她们在家里得不到这些情感需求时，她们会觉得受挫、不满、沮丧、不安。”
en-US: " women seek an emotional connection that their partner notices them , is proud of their achievements , and appreciates what they do , so when they aren't getting this at home the residual effects lead to feelings of frustration , dissatisfaction , depression , and restlessness. "

zh-CN: 这时候她们就可能会另寻关心。
en-US: and that's when they could go looking for it elsewhere .

zh-CN: “当你日复一日地和另一半一起生活后，经常会忽视掉对另一半真正重要的事情。”蕾妮补充道，“随着时间的流逝，一旦女性此时遇到一个可以弥补这些的男性，她们就会视之为感情，进而想和对方进一步发展关系。”
en-US: " when you are living in the day to day with someone , it is challenging to step outside a situation and notice the things that do matter to someone , " adds lee " as this wears down over time , so as soon as the woman encounters someone who ignites the spark they are lacking at home , they equate it to an emotional connection and seek companionship with someone else. "

zh-CN: 3、觉得感情关系走到尽头
en-US: 3 . feeling a relationship ending

zh-CN: “当一个女性觉得这段感情快要枯萎，不管是自己还是对方所致，她可能会向外寻求慰藉来填补目前的空虚，使自己不至于受到太严重的打击。”蕾妮在分析女性的背叛时，认为“如果她是那个想要分手的人，那她可能会用这种策略来挑战自己同时探探风头，然后寻思是否能这样做。”
en-US: " when a woman feels that uneasy sense that a relationship is on the outs , by either her doing or his , she will often look to fill the void externally to soften the blow , " lee reasons for a woman's infidelity. " if she is the one considering the breakup , she may be using this tactic as a challenge to herself both testing the waters , and then gauge if she can go through with it. "

zh-CN: 4、生活没有欢乐
en-US: 4 . it's just not fun anymore

zh-CN: ...但却很难停下来。
en-US: ...but it's too hard to pull the plug .

zh-CN: “当你们之间没有了笑声，没有了爱……欢笑是一段关系中很重要的元素，但却经常被忽略。”蕾妮简单地解释道。
en-US: " when you don't laugh , you don't love. laughter is one of the key elements in a relationship that often gets overlooked , " lee explains , simply .

zh-CN: “当紧张压抑成为每天的主旋律时，女方会觉得不开心。当她们遇到一位可以共度美好时光的同事或朋友时，她们会突然发现这正是目前的感情关系里所没有的，因而会甘愿冒险。”
en-US: " when stresses of day to day life become the dominant factor in a relationship , women feel unhappy. when they come across a coworker , or friend that they have a good time with , it suddenly brings to light what is missing in their own relationship and becomes tempting to act upon. "

zh-CN: 5、床上生活较枯燥。
en-US: 5 . it's boring in the bedroom

zh-CN: 并不是只有男性需要调动情趣。
en-US: men aren't the only ones who need to spice things up .

zh-CN: “女性也需要得到满足。”蕾妮声称。
en-US: " women need to feel desired ! " lee declares .

zh-CN: 如果她的需求得不到满足，女性会开始感到性空虚。
en-US: if she is not getting any , enough , or nothing to talk about , women start to feel a sexual void .

zh-CN: 在女性阅读《五十度灰》等热门书籍、观看电视节目、或听朋友聊单独约会的乐趣时，会将自己的爱情生活和其他人相比较。”蕾妮补充道，“这个时候她会想想自己错过了什么。”
en-US: with the popularity of books such as fifty shades of grey , television shows , or listening to friends talk about their fun single trysts , women have that moment when they compare their love life at home to what the rest of the world seems to be experiencing. " and that's when she may start to wonder what she's missing .

zh-CN: “尽管很容易就可以找出性生活方面的不足之处，但想要改正过来却有些难。”蕾妮补充道，“这会诱使一些女性出去另寻无拘无束的性满足。”
en-US: " though it is easy to pinpoint the flaws in one's sex life , it is often hard to make the changes needed to correct them , " adds lee. " this creates a temptation in women to seek sexual satisfaction elsewhere with someone they don't have the baggage with and can be more uninhibited . "

zh-CN: 现在你明白了为什么女性会出轨。
en-US: now you know why women cheat .

zh-CN: 但是如果你也正打算出轨，先去和另一半分手吧，然后再去找下一位。
en-US: but we say , if you ' re thinking about cheating , just break up with the guy , before you move on to a new one .

zh-CN: 必读：创业怎么找合伙人
en-US: y combinator's paul graham : get a co-founder

zh-CN: 保罗•格雷厄姆使很多创业公司深受触动。
en-US: paul graham has touched a lot of startups .

zh-CN: 这种触动不是感情上的触动（尽管有些创始人把自己的成功在很大程度上归功于他），而是与影响力有关。
en-US: not in the sappy , sentimental way -- though some founders may largely credit him for their success -- but where influence is concerned .

zh-CN: 因为硅谷没有几个人敢说他们接触、建议和投资过的初创公司数量比格雷厄姆更多。
en-US: because few in the valley can claim they have interacted with , advised , and funded as many early-stage businesses as graham has .

zh-CN: 确实，自2005年以来，他与妻子杰西卡•利文斯顿、特雷弗•布莱克维尔和罗伯特•塔潘•莫里斯共同创建的YCombinator创业孵化器已经目睹了632家创业公司进进出出，其中包括Dropbox、Airbnb和在线支付平台Stripe。
en-US: indeed , y combinator , the startup incubator he co-founded with wife jessica livingston , trevor blackwell , and robert tappan morris , has seen 632 startups come and go since 2005 , including dropbox , airbnb , and online payments platform stripe .

zh-CN: 上周，格雷厄姆宣布辞去YCombinator总裁职务，把权杖交给了合伙人萨姆•阿尔特曼。
en-US: last week , graham announced he was stepping down as y combinator president , handing the reins off to partner sam altman .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆将以兼职身份继续为YCombinator的创业公司提供建议，但停止了日常管理工作，比如审查申请和会见申请者。
en-US: in doing so , graham will still offer advice part-time to yc startups but cease day-to-day administrative tasks like poring over applications and interviewing applicants .

zh-CN: “我把所有时间都花在了那些破事上，”格雷厄姆在今年的旧金山科技创业盛会LAUNCHFestival上曾经这样半开玩笑地说过这样一句话。
en-US: " i spend all the time on that crap , " graham half-joked onstage at this year's launch festival in san francisco .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆还根据管理YCombinator的九年经验，在离别时提供了几条创业的大原则。
en-US: graham also offered some parting general startup advice , culled from nine years of running yc .

zh-CN: 找个联合创始人……
en-US: get a co-founder ...

zh-CN: 拥有多位创始人的企业更有可能成功，因为每位联合创始人可能拥有不同的长处。
en-US: businesses are more likely to succeed with more than one founder , because each co-founder may bring different strengths .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆把苹果公司（Apple）作为明显的例子：史蒂夫•乔布斯是营销高手，而专注于技术的史蒂夫•沃兹尼亚克完全不用去关心销售的事情。
en-US: graham used apple ( aapl ) as an easy example : steve jobs was a pro with sales while the tech-focused steve wozniak couldn't have cared less .

zh-CN: 这就是格雷厄姆常常告诉YCombinator申请者去找个联合创始人的原因。
en-US: that's why graham usually tells yc applicants to get a co-founder .

zh-CN: 实际上，Dropbox公司CEO德鲁•休斯顿2007年申请YCombinator投资时，格雷厄姆就是向他提供了这条建议。
en-US: in fact , that's exactly the advice he offered dropbox ceo drew houston when he applied for yc in 2007 .

zh-CN: 据推测，休斯顿应该是接受了这个建议，此后不到两周时间便招募了麻省理工学院（MIT）的同班同学阿莱希•菲尔多西。
en-US: houston supposedly did just that , recruiting mit classmate arash ferdowsi in two weeks .

zh-CN: 7年后的今天，Dropbox在最近一轮融资中募得3.5亿美元，公司估值已经达到了100亿美元。格雷厄姆回忆说，这个数字远远高于休斯顿在进入YCombinator的早期日子里愿意接受的Dropbox卖价。
en-US: now , seven years later , dropbox has raised $350 million in its latest round with a valuation of $10 billion , far less than the amount graham recalls houston would have been willing to sell dropbox for in the early yc days .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆回忆说：“那时他愿意接受的Dropbox卖价肯定低于1,000万美元，甚至有可能低于100万或200万美元。”
en-US: " the answer was definitely under $10 million -- it might have been under a $1 million or $2 million , " he recalled .

zh-CN: 但要找个你真正喜欢的联合创始人……
en-US: but get a co-founder you actually like ...

zh-CN: 这是基本原则？当然。
en-US: basic ? sure .

zh-CN: 但你会吃惊地发现，很多创业公司的创始人并不明白这一点。
en-US: but you ' d be surprised how many startup founders actually don't gel .

zh-CN: 就三家最成功的YCombinator创业公司（Airbnb、Dropbox和Stripe）而言，格雷厄姆和工作人员接受它们申请的决定在很大程度上依据的是联合创始人本身以及他们相处是否融洽（当然，有个好创意没有坏处）。
en-US: with yc's three most successful startups -- airbnb , dropbox , and stripe -- much of graham and crew's acceptance decision was based on the co-founders themselves and how well they got along. ( of course , a promising idea didn't hurt. )

zh-CN: 如果他们相处不融洽呢？
en-US: and if they don't ?

zh-CN: 这很容易看出来，YCombinator面谈时间只有可怜的8到10分钟。
en-US: well , that's easy to tell quickly enough , even during a yc interview , which spans a pithy eight to 10 minutes .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆说：“如果一位联合创始人向我们推介时，另一位却在翻白眼。这就是确凿无疑的信号。”
en-US: " one guy literally rolled his eyes when his co-founder was talking and pitching us -- a surefire tell , " graham said .

zh-CN: 专注于明确具体的用户子集……
en-US: focus on a specific subset of users ...

zh-CN: 长时间投身创投的人通常都曾投资过一家拥有好创意、但从未真正腾飞的创业公司。
en-US: longtime startup investors usually have one startup that had a nifty idea but never quite took off .

zh-CN: 对于格雷厄姆来说，那就是Etherpad。
en-US: for graham , it's etherpad .

zh-CN: Appjet在2008年11月发布了这款应用。格雷厄姆接受了这家创业公司的申请，因为他“非常喜欢这个创意”。
en-US: released in november 2008 by appjet , graham accepted the startup into ycombinator because he " liked the idea so much. "

zh-CN: 从本质上来说，Etherpad是GoogleDocs的竞争对手：这款功能丰富、基于网络的文档编辑器可以让多位用户展开协作，对文档进行实时撰写和编辑（谷歌在2009年底收购了这款软件）。
en-US: essentially , etherpad was a google docs ( goog ) competitor : a feature-rich , web-based text editor that let multiple users collaborate , write , and edit documents in real-time. ( google acquired the software in late 2009. )

zh-CN: 问题在于，这个产品缺乏焦点。
en-US: problem was , the product lacked focus .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆说：“他们应该让人们意识到，‘嘿，这个不只是实时输入。’”
en-US: " they should have launched it as one thing and let people realize , ' hey this is much more than real-time typing , ' " graham offered .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆说，增长的秘诀不是广泛撒网，而是“小范围的密集开火”。首先专注于一个用户子集，满足他们的需求。
en-US: instead of a catch-all approach , graham said the secret to growth is starting a " small , intense fire " - - first focus on a subset of users and meet their needs .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆再次以苹果为例：苹果公司的第一款个人电脑AppleI只生产了200台，但在上市销售的头10个月里售出了175台，大部分卖给了计算机爱好者。
en-US: again , graham brought up apple as an example : the company produced just 200 units of its first personal computer , the apple i , but sold 175 of them within the first 10 months on sale , largely to computer hobbyists .

zh-CN: 格雷厄姆解释说：“你必须知道第一批用户是谁，和他们坐下来，办个聚会，把注意力放到他们身上。”
en-US: explained graham : " you ' ve got to know who those first users are , sit with them , have a party , and focus on them . "

zh-CN: 外国领导人为什么都爱参观硅谷
en-US: why foreign leaders love silicon valley

zh-CN: 访问美国的外国元首在开展国际外交的时候原本可以在行程中加入长长一列度假胜地。
en-US: foreign leaders visiting the united states can fill their itineraries from a long list of fabulous destinations to conduct international diplomacy .

zh-CN: 风景优美的名山、温和宜人的海滩和某个不夜城似乎都是最佳的选择。
en-US: scenic mountains , balmy beaches , and a certain city that never sleeps would seem like top contenders .

zh-CN: 然而，世界各地的总统和首相们却纷纷选择了硅谷这个办公园区林立、郊区扩张无序的地方。
en-US: but instead , presidents and prime ministers from around the world are flocking to silicon valley , the land of office parks and suburban sprawl .

zh-CN: 看来，结识谷歌（Google）、Facebook和苹果（Apple）的高管们与在华盛顿首府合影和会谈几乎具有同等的重要性。
en-US: getting to know top executives from google ( goog ) , facebook ( fb ) , and apple ( aapl ) , it turns out , is almost as important as photo-ops and meetings in washington , d.c.

zh-CN: 上周，法国总统弗朗索瓦•奥朗德成为了最近一个造访全球科技之都的国家领导人。
en-US: last week , french president françois hollande became the latest such figure to make a pilgrimage to the world's technology capital .

zh-CN: 过去的几年中，以色列、爱尔兰、新西兰、土耳其、俄罗斯、荷兰、立陶宛和马来西亚的元首也都曾经来到这里参观。
en-US: in the last few years , leaders from israel , ireland , new zealand , turkey , russia , netherlands , lithuania , and malaysia have also visited .

zh-CN: 他们对硅谷的兴趣反映了硅谷公司和风险投资家们日益强大的影响力。各国元首正在向他们示好，希望从这些顶尖的创新思维中找出经商、投资和提高政治声誉的办法。
en-US: their interest reflects the growing muscle of silicon valley companies and venture capitalists , with which heads of state are trying to curry favor in hopes of attracting business , investment , and any political cachet that comes from championing innovation .

zh-CN: 多年来陪同过多位外国代表团的斯坦福大学前教务长威廉•米勒说：“他们盯着的是就业机会。他们同时也觉得，无论是英特尔（Intel）还是谷歌，只要大型公司在他们的国家落户，就会吸引其他的大公司。”
en-US: " they're looking for jobs , " said william miller , a former provost at stanford university who accompanied a number of foreign delegations in silicon valley over the years . " they also have a feeling that a larger company -- whether intel or google -- could locate there and become a magnet for others. "

zh-CN: 奥朗德在短暂的访问期间会见了许多硅谷的顶级高管。
en-US: during his brief visit , hollande met with dozens of top silicon valley executives .

zh-CN: 他邀请了谷歌的董事会主席埃里克•施密特，Facebook首席运营官谢丽尔•桑德伯格和Twitter的共同创始人杰克•多西共进私人午餐。
en-US: a private lunch included eric schmidt , google's chairman ; sheryl sandberg , chief operating officer at facebook ; and twitter ( twtr ) co-founder jack dorsey .

zh-CN: 此外，奥朗德还在旧金山设立了一个新的科技孵化器来帮助法国的初创公司，后者目前尚未在世界上掀起潮流。
en-US: in addition , hollande opened a new technology incubator in san francisco for french startups , which aren't exactly taking the world by storm from home .

zh-CN: 通常由国外政府赞助、专门扶持某国企业的孵化器迅速成为了硅谷的一道风景。
en-US: incubators devoted to just one country , which are often sponsored by foreign governments , have fast become a silicon valley fixture .

zh-CN: 以色列、爱尔兰、丹麦、德国和澳大利亚是最早一批赞助新公司、帮助它们与美国投资商和合伙人接触的国家。
en-US: israel , ireland , denmark , germany , and australia are among those with beachheads that support young companies and help with access to u.s. investors and partners .

zh-CN: 外国领导人的参观剧本已经形成了固定的路数。
en-US: the playbook followed by foreign leaders is well-established .

zh-CN: 他们从旧金山下飞机，举办几场活动表现出他们对一切科技问题的热衷，然后与几位著名的科技公司高管共进美味午餐，或者在市政厅接见他们。
en-US: get off the plane in san francisco , hold a few events to highlight their enthusiasm for all things tech , then mingle with a few well-known tech executives over a gourmet lunch or at a town hall meeting .

zh-CN: 2012年，以色列总统西蒙•佩雷斯为推动以色列初创公司的发展，展开了四天的硅谷之旅。期间，他访问了Facebook总部。
en-US: in 20 12 , shimon peres , israel's president , made the trip to facebook's headquarters during a four-day tour of silicon valley to promote israeli startups .

zh-CN: 与桑德伯格进行公开会谈时，他把自己形容为社交网络的粉丝。
en-US: during an interview on stage with sandberg , he described himself as a fan of social networking .

zh-CN: 他表示，不同政府部门的公务员可以利用社交网络协同工作，和平共处——尽管中东从来都没真正存在过什么和平。
en-US: people can use it , he said , to work around governments and achieve peace on their own -- although peace in the middle east seems to be just as elusive now as ever .

zh-CN: 去年，海地总理洛朗•拉莫特到访期间罕见地连续拜访了Facebook、谷歌和苹果的总部。
en-US: last year , haiti's prime minister , laurent lamothe , made a rare trifecta by visiting the headquarters of facebook , google , and apple in one stateside trip .

zh-CN: 当时，他的国家刚刚遭受地震，极其贫困，正是向富有的科技公司请求经济和就业援助的好机会。
en-US: it was an opportunity to ask wealthy technology companies to help his impoverished country , which is reeling from a devastating earthquake , with jobs and aid .

zh-CN: 这些公司捐赠了免费的服务器和一些额外的网络工具。
en-US: the companies donated free servers and some premium online tools .

zh-CN: 但是海地几乎没有人能在家里上网，与海地的种种困难相比，这些援助只是杯水车薪。
en-US: but few haitians have online connections at home , and pledges were small compared to the country's myriad problems .

zh-CN: 就如许多访问硅谷的国家元首一样，奥朗德也试图向国内传达他支持创新、力图将法国建设成“初创公司共和国”的信息。
en-US: like many heads of state that visit silicon valley , hollande was trying to send a message back home that he supports innovation and is working to turn france into a " startup republic . "

zh-CN: 但许多法国企业家谴责奥朗德，称他颁布新法、将最高税率定为75%是在掏空他们。
en-US: but many french entrepreneurs accuse hollande of undermining them with a new law that sets the top tax rate at 75% .

zh-CN: 奥朗德回避了公众对税务问题的意见，对美国向法国公司的投资表示了欢迎。
en-US: avoiding the tax issue in public comments , hollande threw out a welcome mat for american investment in french companies .

zh-CN: 他指出，向法国投资的美国公司中，有三分之一来自加利福尼亚。
en-US: of all the american investment in french companies , one-third comes from california , he pointed out .

zh-CN: “来到加利福尼亚，人就想要改变世界，而这是一个美丽的使命，也是一个雄心勃勃的使命。但我们能够理解，因为我们有着同样的愿景，”奥朗德在旧金山市政大厅的演讲中说。
en-US: " in california , you want to change the world , and it's a beautiful mission -- a very ambitious mission , but one we really understand because we have the same vision , " he said in a speech at san francisco's city hall .

zh-CN: 几个世纪以来，法国一直都想要改变世界，而我们携手并进，足以达成这一目标。
en-US: for centuries , france wanted to change the world , and together we can change the world .

zh-CN: 我们可以改变我们的消费模式、生产模式，以至于我们应对健康问题和技术问题的手段，从而让世界变得更加美好。
en-US: we can change the way we consume , we produce -- the way we deal with health or technology in order to make the world a better place .

zh-CN: 通常，外国领导人会对他们与正在讨好的科技公司之间存在的分歧避而不谈。
en-US: usually , foreign leaders steer clear of the differences they have with the technology companies they're courting .

zh-CN: 毕竟，在隐私、人权和法律管制问题上引起紧张情绪是没必要的。
en-US: no need to inflame tensions , after all , over issues like privacy , human rights , and regulations .

zh-CN: 奥朗德政府正在调查谷歌、Facebook和LinkedIn这类科技公司是否存在非法偷税漏税的问题。
en-US: hollande's government is probing whether technology companies like google , facebook , and linkedin ( lnkd ) illegally dodged taxes .

zh-CN: 此外，法国政府最近还惩罚了谷歌侵犯隐私的行为，要求它在网站首页保留48小时的尴尬的道歉声明。
en-US: moreover , france recently punished google for privacy violations by requiring it to post an embarrassing notice about its misdeeds on its home page for 48 hours .

zh-CN: 谷歌并未就奥朗德的拜访、法国政府及针对谷歌进行的调查问题发表相关评论。
en-US: google did not respond to requests for comment about hollande's visit or his government or targeting it with investigations .

zh-CN: Facebook只是发表了一个模糊的声明，类似于“我们携手并进。”
en-US: facebook would only give a vague statement along the lines of , " let's all work together . "

zh-CN: Facebook表示：“能够会见奥朗德总统及其政府成员，开诚布公地讨论法国及其在培养创新精神、吸引国外投资问题上扮演的角色，我们对这样的机会表示欢迎。”
en-US: " we welcomed the opportunity to meet with president hollande and some members of his government for an open discussion about france and its role in fostering innovation and attracting foreign investment , " facebook said .

zh-CN: 外国领导人纷纷来到硅谷的现象并不新奇。
en-US: the phenomenon of foreign leaders flocking to silicon valley isn't entirely new .

zh-CN: 沃尔特•艾萨克森2011年在乔布斯的传记中写道，另一位法国总统弗朗索瓦•密特朗1984年年也造访过硅谷。当时，他的妻子丹尼尔并没有探讨科技问题，而是尖刻地就加班工资和假期之类的员工福利问题向史蒂夫•乔布斯发问。
en-US: françois mitterand , another french president , toured silicon valley in 1984 , during which his wife danielle , peppered steve jobs with uncomfortable questions about worker welfare like overtime pay and vacations rather than gushing about the technology , according to walter isaacson's 2011 biography of jobs .

zh-CN: 硅谷崛起前，外国领导人会访问“铁锈地带”的工厂。
en-US: before silicon valley's rise , foreign leaders visited factories in the rust belt .

zh-CN: 如今，他们怀着同样的目的，只是迅速发展的行业已经不同以往了。
en-US: now , it's the same idea , just a different growth industry .

zh-CN: 硅谷的领袖有时会对所受的关注投桃报李。
en-US: silicon valley leaders reciprocate some of the attention they receive .

zh-CN: 他们出国时，往往会受到热烈的欢迎。
en-US: when they go abroad , they often find a warm reception .

zh-CN: Facebook董事长马克•扎克伯格2012年去日本时会见了日本首相安倍晋三。
en-US: mark zuckerberg , facebook's chief executive , met with prime minister shinzo abe during a trip to japan in 2012 .

zh-CN: 而去年，他和首席运营官谢丽尔•桑德伯格都会见了韩国总统朴槿惠。
en-US: and last year , both he and sheryl sandberg , facebook's chief operating officer , met with south korea's president park geun-hye .

zh-CN: 会见并不总是礼节性的，有时也会达成真正的商业外交。
en-US: meetings aren't always courtesy calls. in some cases , some real business-diplomacy is done .

zh-CN: 去年在巴黎与奥朗德的一次联席会议上，谷歌的施密特签署协议，承诺谷歌公司将提供8,000万美元帮助法国媒体公司进行在线展示。
en-US: last year , in a joint meeting in paris with hollande , google's schmidt signed an agreement in which the company pledged to pay $80 million to help french media companies build their presence online .

zh-CN: 此前，法国的新闻媒体曾指控谷歌在搜索结果中显示了他们作品的片段，涉嫌窃取他们的内容，而这份协议则达成了彼此之间的和解。
en-US: the deal settled a dispute in which french news outlets accused google of stealing their content by showing snippets of their work in search results .

zh-CN: 硅谷的领袖又能得到什么回报呢？
en-US: what do silicon valley leaders get in return ?

zh-CN: 很多。
en-US: plenty .

zh-CN: 一旦这些国家的政府就知识产权、移民、许可之类的问题起草法案时，这些身居高位的朋友们就能帮上大忙。
en-US: friends in high places can only help when it comes time for their governments to draft regulations about intellectual property , immigration , and permitting , for example .

zh-CN: 实质性的商业交易至少在短期内不会时常发生。
en-US: actual business deals are few and far between , at least in the short term .

zh-CN: 但会面有时会让沟通变得更顺畅。
en-US: but the meetings can sometimes get the ball rolling .

zh-CN: 斯坦福大学前教务长米勒这样评论首席执行官们的想法：“大家有一种感觉，如果世界上的其他地方正在变得更好，我们也能变得更好。它并不是竞争，而是合作。如今的产品创新已经不再局限于某一个地方了。”
en-US: " there's a sense that if the rest of the world is doing better , we'll do better , " miller , the former stanford provost , said of the ceo mindset. " it's not competition but cooperation. product innovation doesn't just occur in one place anymore. "

zh-CN: 金融行业沦为自杀高发行业？
en-US: is there a suicide contagion on wall street ?

zh-CN: 几天前，一位华尔街高管因为能不能请会儿假去上城区看心理医生与别人发生争执。
en-US: a few days ago , a wall street executive was debating whether he could get away from the office long enough to see his shrink uptown .

zh-CN: 在一个繁忙的工作日，这看似不太可能。
en-US: in the midst of a busy workday , it was looking unlikely .

zh-CN: 随后，这位高管碰巧看到了《纽约邮报》（NewYorkPost）上一则让人闹心的消息，内容是摩根大通香港员工跳楼身亡。就在三周前，摩根大通另一名工作人员也从该行伦敦总部楼顶一跃而下。
en-US: then he stumbled across an article in the new york post with the disquieting news that a j.p. morgan chase ( jpm ) employee had jumped to his death from the bank's offices in hong kong , just three weeks after a fellow banker at the firm had committed suicide by jumping off the roof of the bank's london headquarters .

zh-CN: 《纽约邮报》这篇文章的题目是《摩根大通几周内连续爆出三起员工神秘自杀身亡事件》。
en-US: " jpmorgan suicide is 3rd mysterious death in weeks , " read the post headline .

zh-CN: 这位高管还是去看了他的心理医生奥尔登•卡斯。
en-US: the executive went to his appointment .

zh-CN: 后者回忆道：“他说，‘这件事促使我今天到你的办公室来，我想确认自己没有问题。’”除了金融公司高管，卡斯还有很多客户，其中包括投资经理人、投行人士以及各式各样的交易员。
en-US: " he said , ' that's what drove me into your office today , i want to make sure that i'm all right , ' " says alden cass , the psychologist who treats the executive , as well as a bunch of clients who are portfolio managers , investment bankers , and traders of all types .

zh-CN: 自杀事件集中出现，受到震撼的不仅是华尔街。
en-US: the rash of suicides has sent a shudder through wall street and beyond .

zh-CN: 《纽约邮报》提到的第三起死亡事件看起来不像是自杀——摩根大通一位执行董事今年1月份死在康涅狄格州的家里（死因报告尚未公布）。
en-US: the third death referenced by the post— that of a j.p. morgan executive director who died inside his connecticut home in january — did not appear to be intentional. ( a report is still pending. )

zh-CN: 其实，去年8月底以来，金融行业至少已有六人自杀，摩根大通的员工死亡事件只是出现的最晚而已。
en-US: yet the j.p. morgan incidents are only the most recent in a string of at least a half-dozen suicides in the financial world since late august .

zh-CN: 发生同样悲剧的还有苏黎世保险集团、德意志银行和RussellInvestments等公司。
en-US: those include executives at zurich insurance group ( zurvy ) , deutsche bank ( db ) , and russell investments , among other firms .

zh-CN: 银行业人员自杀不是什么新鲜事。
en-US: banker suicides aren't a new phenomenon .

zh-CN: 上世纪30年代大萧条以及最近一次的经济大衰退期间，银行业人员都曾接二连三地自杀。
en-US: clusters of them in quick succession occurred during the great depression and during the recent great recession .

zh-CN: 实际上可以这么说，相关研究已经证明自杀会传染。
en-US: indeed , research has shown that suicides can be contagious , so to speak .

zh-CN: 美国自杀学协会指出，情况确实如此，有关自杀的图片和煽情报道会引起他人的效仿。
en-US: that is particularly true when graphic and sensational reports of the fatalities lead to copycats , according to the american association of suicidology .

zh-CN: 因此，最近这些不合时宜的死亡事件已经开始让人们担心可能还会有人自杀。
en-US: so the recent untimely deaths have sparked concerns that there could be more on the way .

zh-CN: 摩根大通发言人乔•埃万杰利斯蒂表示，公司已经通知员工，摩根大通可以随时为他们提供精神健康方面的帮助，而且公司对已故员工的家属深表同情。
en-US: j.p. morgan spokesman joe evangelisti says the company has sent notices reminding employees that 24/7 mental health-related support resources are available at the bank , and that its hearts go out to the families of the deceased .

zh-CN: 不过，自杀事件的集中爆发每每都会带来这样的问题——这些死亡事件是否代表了一种让人不安的情况，那就是，从事金融业可能有生命危险？
en-US: but with each new wave of suicides come questions about whether the deaths signify a disturbing trend : is finance a potentially deadly occupation ?

zh-CN: 或者说，银行业人员自杀的几率比其他行业高吗？
en-US: that is , do bankers kill themselves more often than other people ?

zh-CN: 为了找到答案，本刊邀请美国疾病控制与预防中心从它的国家职业死亡率监测数据库中调出了最新的自杀数据。
en-US: to find out , fortune asked the centers for disease control and prevention to pull the latest suicide statistics from its national occupational mortality surveillance database .

zh-CN: 近些年来，相关研究获得资金支持并且有数据可循的年份包括1999、2003、2004和2007年。在这四个年份中，有329名金融业从业者自杀，超过了该中心跟踪的其他任何行业。只有“工程师和科学家”这个大类出现了502名自杀者，多于金融业。
en-US: during 1999 , 2003 , 2004 , and 2007 — the most recent years during which research was funded and for which data is available — there were 329 suicides among financial specialists , more than in any other occupation tracked by the cdc except for the broad grouping of " engineers and scientists , " a cohort that lost 502 to suicide .

zh-CN: 但金融业的覆盖范围很广，虽然自杀的金融从业人员总数可能超过其他一些行业，但金融业人士自杀的可能性实际上要低于某些职业，比如说律师和消防员。
en-US: finance , however , is a vast profession , and while the total number of finance professionals who commit suicide may be larger than for some other professions , they are actually less likely to do so than , say , lawyers or firefighters .

zh-CN: 以摩根大通为例，这家银行全球员工总数超过26万人，出现两起自杀事件可能显得很吓人而且毫无规律，但实际上，这个数字完全符合统计概率。
en-US: take j.p. morgan as an example : at a bank with more than 2 60,000 employees around the globe , a pair of suicides may seem shocking and random but the figure is , in fact , well within the range of statistical probability .

zh-CN: 有两名员工自杀甚至可能属于较低水平。
en-US: two might even be a low number .

zh-CN: 宾夕法尼亚大学管理学教授亚历山德拉•米歇尔曾在高盛投行部门任职。她目前正在进行一项研究，因此12年来一直在跟踪两家华尔街银行（她不能透露这两家银行的名称）一批新雇员的表现和健康情况。米歇尔说：“他们的工作时间很长，外界会对他们有这样的看法，人们会认为他们自杀的频率要高得多。”
en-US: " you would expect that when people work these long hours , " says alexandra michel , a former goldman sachs ( gs ) investment banker turned management professor at the university of pennsylvania who for 12 years has been tracking the performance and health of a group of wall street recruits at two banks ( she can't say which ) in an ongoing study. " you would think that it would happen much more often. "

zh-CN: 仔细查看疾病控制与预防中心的数据后，我们并没有发现那个让人担心的现象，即某种金融工作的自杀风险较高。
en-US: a close examination of the cdc data does reveal a worrisome connection between certain types of financial jobs and an elevated risk of suicide .

zh-CN: 该中心按人口普查的方式计算死亡率，这种方法可能相当笼统。
en-US: the cdc organizes its mortality numbers by census categories , which can be pretty broad .

zh-CN: 在该中心的统计类别中，和华尔街属于同一性质的是“金融和商业服务销售代表”——它包含了各种各样的银行业工作——从投资顾问、经纪人到交易员，再到投行人员。
en-US: the wall street-oriented classification is " sales representatives for financial and business services " — a category that includes a variety of banking positions , ranging from investment advisers to brokers to traders to investment bankers .

zh-CN: 这个类别的自杀可能性比整个就业者群体高39%（某些白领职业的自杀风险甚至更高：律师的自杀几率比平均值高54%，医生则高97%。）
en-US: people in that group are 39% more likely to kill themselves than the workforce as a whole. ( members of some other white-collar professions are at even greater risk : lawyers are 54% more likely than average to commit suicide , and physicians are 97% more likely . )

zh-CN: 观察人士认为，在金融行业中，精神压力最大的往往是投行人员。
en-US: within finance , observers say that investment bankers are often under the most acute mental stress .

zh-CN: 卡斯指出：“据我所知，在所有金融领域中，对情感耐受力的要求最为极端的非投资银行莫属。”卡斯还和人共同撰写了一本书，名叫《牛市思维：华尔街生存和成功指南》
en-US: " out of all the sections of finance , no position do i know of that's more extreme in terms of the emotional endurance one has to have than investment banking , " says cass , the psychologist who is also the co-author of bullish thinking : the advisor's guide to surviving and thriving on wall street .

zh-CN: 米歇尔还观察到，随着时间推移，投行人员会出现一种综合症。
en-US: it's a syndrome michel has also observed while shadowing investment bankers over the years .

zh-CN: 她发现，观察对象在华尔街银行平均工作四年后开始出现失眠、焦虑和抑郁等情况。
en-US: after her subjects had worked at a bank for four years on average , she began observing signs of sleeplessness , anxiety , and depression :

zh-CN: 米歇尔说：“我能看到他们刚开始还能心情愉悦地和朋友打电话，然后这种现象就会越来越少见。他们完全陷在了办公室里，陷在了工作里。有些人觉得自己被困住了。”
en-US: " i could see how people came in chatting happily on the phone with friends , how that became less and less , " she says. " people became completely absorbed in the office , in work. some are feeling trapped . "

zh-CN: 摩根大通表示，这两名自杀的员工本质上不属于投行部门。
en-US: j.p. morgan says the two employees who committed suicide weren't investment bankers , per se .

zh-CN: 他们在领英（LinkedIn）上的个人简介显示，加布里埃尔•马吉是摩根大通伦敦方面固定收益证券部门负责技术事务的副总裁，李俊杰（音译）则是为投行业务提供支持的票据部门副经理。
en-US: according to their linkedin ( lnkd ) profiles , gabriel magee was a vice president overseeing technology for fixed-income securities in the london office , and dennis li was an associate in the billing department supporting the investment bank .

zh-CN: 但就整个华尔街来说，这个高风险领域的工作压力比以前更大。
en-US: but the high-stakes world of wall street has become a more stressful work environment across the board .

zh-CN: 卡斯说，2008年的经济危机以及随后的衰退让问题变得更加严重，特别是出现了一些新的因素之后，比如奖金缩水，经常裁员以及监管更加严格。
en-US: the 2008 economic crisis and subsequent recession have exacerbated the problem , says cass , especially now that the new reality of smaller bonus checks , regular layoffs , and heightened regulation has sunk in .

zh-CN: 虽然这些因素给很多职业都带来了冲击，但卡斯指出：“投行工作已经成了一个筛选过程，也就是说，要看谁能坚持住，谁坚持不了。”
en-US: while those factors have impacted many professions , cass says , " in investment banking , it becomes a weed-out process—who can take it and who can't ? "

zh-CN: 卡斯已经注意到严密监督给自己的客户带来的压力。
en-US: cass has noticed the scrutiny weighing on his clients .

zh-CN: 他说，从最高层传递下来的焦虑情绪充斥在公司文化当中，银行业员工都处于“草木皆兵的状态”，总是担心自己能否保住饭碗，更有甚者，总是担心自己遭到刑事指控。
en-US: the anxiety has trickled down from bosses and pervaded the culture , he says , with bankers kept in a " fear position , " worrying constantly about keeping their jobs — or worse , facing criminal charges .

zh-CN: 疾病控制与预防中心要到2015年才能公布2008年起各类职业自杀数据的分析结果。
en-US: a cdc analysis of suicides by occupation for 2008 and beyond won't be ready until 2015 .

zh-CN: 但这个中心最近发布报告称，1999-2010年间，在年龄足以达到职业生涯顶峰或者稳居高级管理职位的美国人当中，自杀事件的增长幅度令人担心。
en-US: but the government agency recently reported an alarming increase in suicides between 1999 and 2010 among americans old enough to be at the peak of their careers or well-established in the c-suite .

zh-CN: 这个群体的年龄介于35-64岁，在上述时间段内他们的自杀人数增加了28%，白人（上升了40%）和50岁以上（增幅超过48%）人群的增速更快。
en-US: suicides among 35- to 64-year-olds rose 28% , with even larger increases among white people ( 40% ) and those over 50 ( more than 48% ) .

zh-CN: 卡斯警告，虽然指责具体的某一家公司或金融行业本身并不公平。但他认为，避免失误的压力日益增长，正在对银行业人员产生不利影响。
en-US: while it's not fair , warns cass , to point blame at any one firm or the industry itself , he sees the increased pressure to avoid mistakes as taking its toll on bankers .

zh-CN: 他说：“显然，它有益于我们在金融安全方面的长期整体健康。”
en-US: " obviously it's good for the collective health of our financial security in the long run , " he says .

zh-CN: 而在短期内，卡斯的客户们还会继续来见他。
en-US: for the near term , his clients are keeping their appointments .

zh-CN: “小金人”背后的秘密
en-US: the secrets to winning an academy award

zh-CN: 如果你觉得今年的奥斯卡很无聊，结果在你的预料之中，那么你和很多人想到一块去了。
en-US: if the oscars seem boring and predictable to you this year , then you ' re in good company .

zh-CN: 社会学家早就认为奥斯卡奖是可以预测的。
en-US: sociologists have considered the academy awards predictable for a long time .

zh-CN: 几周前，我和加布里尔•罗斯曼（洛杉矶加州大学的一位社会学家）聊起经济和流行文化结合方面最有意思的一些研究。
en-US: a few weeks ago , i spoke with gabriel rossman , a ucla sociologist with some of the most interesting research on the intersection of economics and pop culture .

zh-CN: 罗斯曼手头有两篇关于奥斯卡的论文，很有意思。
en-US: rossman has two fascinating papers about the oscars .

zh-CN: 第一篇解答了一直困扰人们的问题：一部影片具备什么样的条件才能获得奥斯卡提名？
en-US: the first addressed the tantalizing question : what qualities of a movie best predict oscars nominations ?

zh-CN: 令人并不感到意外的是，最大的因素是和影片的严肃性相关。
en-US: unsurprisingly , the biggest correlation was being in a very serious movie .

zh-CN: 通过研究IMDB上20000部影片的172000次点映，罗斯曼和论文的另一个作者妮可•埃斯帕扎发现，剧情片比其他类型影片获提名的可能性高出九倍。
en-US: considering 172,000 performances listed on imdb in 20,000 movies , rossman and co-author nicole esparza found that dramas were were nine times more likely to get nominations .

zh-CN: 第二大和第三大因素都和竞争的规模相关。
en-US: the second and third best predictors both had to do with the size of the competition .

zh-CN: 当颁奖季上映的影片很少时，任何一部影片获得提名的机会就增加了。
en-US: when there are fewer films released around awards season , the odds that any one movie gets a nomination increases .

zh-CN: 很不幸的是，这个简单的规则同样适用于女演员获奖提名。
en-US: this simple principle applies , rather unfortunately , to actresses , as well .

zh-CN: 有证据表明，在可能被提名奥斯卡奖的影片里，内容充实的女性角色很少，这是行规。
en-US: it's an industry truism , borne out in the evidence , that women have fewer meaty roles in the types of movies likely to be nominated for an oscar .

zh-CN: 这意味着，一个女演员年末任何一个打动人心的表演都很可能获得提名。
en-US: that means any one dramatic end-of-year performance by a woman has a higher chance of earning a nomination .

zh-CN: 也许论文最重大的发现是，在过去的影片评分中，影片获得IMDB高评分的人更容易和其他明星相处，使得他们得到提名的机会也翻了一番。
en-US: perhaps the most substantive finding in the paper is that people with high imdb movie rankings in past movie credits were more likely to work with other stars , doubling their chances at getting a nomination .

zh-CN: 罗斯曼告诉《洛杉矶加州大学校报》“演员和有才华的人合作将表现良好”，“这是件很有意思的事，因为你倾向于使有才华的人聚在一起工作，这意味着他们最后会比一个人工作时表现要好。”
en-US: “ actors are going to look good when they work with talented people , " rossman told the daily bruin. " this is an interesting thing since you tend to get talented people working with other talented people , meaning that people will end up looking even better than when just working alone. ”

zh-CN: 可能你很明白：好的演员得到好的角色，能够和好的导演一起共事。
en-US: maybe this seems completely obvious to you : better actors get better parts and then get to work with better directors ( hello , leonardo dicaprio ) .

zh-CN: 但是这也是一个典型的被社会学家称为积累优势或“马太效应”的例子。“马太效应”这个名字来源于《马太福音》，在这部著作中耶稣说道“凡有的，还要给他更多使他变得富有。”
en-US: but it's also a classic example of what sociologists call cumulative advantage or the " matthew effect , " named after the passage in matthew where jesus says " for to everyone who has , more will be given and he will grow rich . "

zh-CN: 这并不是简单的“富有的变得更加富有”。
en-US: this isn't as simple as the rich getting richer .

zh-CN: 这说的是稍微更具才华的人会获得更优质的支持从而大幅增加他们固有的优势（例如，更聪明的学生上大学接触更好的老师获得更好的职业发展机会）。
en-US: it's the idea that slightly more talented people get access to higher-quality support for their talents , which greatly multiplies the benefits of their innate advantage ( e.g. : smarter students going to colleges with better professors and better career services connections ) .

zh-CN: 有明星的影片会得到奥斯卡更多的关注，这可能表明好莱坞的明星比不是明星的演员更出色。
en-US: the fact that movies with stars get more oscar attention might be an indication that hollywood's stars are simply better than its non-stars .

zh-CN: 但恐怕不是这样。
en-US: but probably not .

zh-CN: （正如你所怀疑的那样）这可能更多地表明在众星云集的电影行业中，我们不善于挑选出个别的有才华的演员。
en-US: it's much more likely a sign that ( just as you might have suspected ) we're bad picking out discrete instances of talent in star-studded projects .

zh-CN: 这暗示，我们——或至少是奥斯卡——一样地不善于认可没有任何曾提名过奥斯卡的演员但颇具才气、值得奥斯卡奖的影片。
en-US: this would imply we — or , at least , the academy—is just as bad at recognizing oscar-worthy talentin movies without any past oscar nominees .

zh-CN: 在这两种情况下，大环境支配我们认可个人成就的能力。
en-US: in both cases , the context overwhelms our ability to recognize individual achievement .

zh-CN: 罗斯曼第二篇关于奥斯卡的论文是关于观众和奖项的。
en-US: rossman's second oscar paper is about audiences and prizes. some producers really want to win oscars .

zh-CN: 一些制作人真的很想要获得奥斯卡奖。这些制作人可能想赚钱。
en-US: these producers would also , presumably , like to make money .

zh-CN: 问题是，大部分的“奥斯卡奖影片”——这里指的是上映的晚，话题沉重（像艾滋病、奴隶制、技术敌托邦）——观众都不喜欢。因此，制作一个为奥斯卡量身定制的影片这门生意是风险很高的，高回报则不一定。
en-US: the problem is that audiences don't like most movies that are " academy award movies " — here defined as late-year releases about serious subjects ( like aids , slavery , or technological dystopia ) — so the business of making an oscar-y movie is high-risk with dubiously high reward .

zh-CN: 这一点罗斯曼解释得很好：
en-US: rossman explains it well :

zh-CN: 事实上，观众不喜欢“试图”得到奥斯卡提名的影片，但确实喜欢真正"得到"奥斯卡提名的影片。
en-US: it turns out that audiences dislike movies that are *trying* to get oscar nominations but really like movies that actually *get* oscar nominations .

zh-CN: 根据推理，如果没有奥斯卡推动票房，那么关于战胜压迫的历史人物的影片将会少之又少。
en-US: by inference , if there were no oscars to drive box office towards them , there would be far fewer movies about historical protagonists overcoming oppression .

zh-CN: 的确，好像好莱坞基本上敲定了奥斯卡，因为他们生产的影片的数量正好是奥斯卡需要的影片数量，他们基本上持平了。
en-US: indeed , it looks like hollywood basically nails it since they make exactly the right number of oscar-targeted movies that the two effects balance out on average .

zh-CN: 胜利者总有点备受宠爱。
en-US: to the victors go the spoils , kind of .

zh-CN: 据市场研究公司IBISWorld讲，最佳摄影奖获得者在提名之后可以获得票房的22%，在获奖之后可以再获得15%。
en-US: best picture winners can expect a 22 percentraise in box office after a nomination and another 15 percent bump if they win , according to ibisworld .

zh-CN: 但是光计算金钱可能遗漏掉试图制造一部奥斯卡影片的最佳原因：在本行业内赢得荣誉，获得将来能为你赚更多钱的明星，或仅仅是为了获得制作一部真正伟大影片的荣誉。
en-US: but the financial calculations probably miss the best reasons to try to make an oscar movie : to win accolades within the industry , to win access to stars who can make you more money down the line and , just maybe , to bask in the honor of making a truly great film .

zh-CN: 职业女性应警惕“电脑脸”
en-US: screens put years on you : ' computer face' is giving women jowls and lines

zh-CN: 一位权威整容外科医生指出，越来越多的女性正在患上一种被称作“电脑脸”的症状。
en-US: a growing number of women are developing something called ' computer face ' , a leading cosmetic surgeon said .

zh-CN: 迈克尔•普拉杰医生说，职业女性长时间在电脑前工作，将会导致她们面颊下垂、出现“火鸡脖”、前额和眼睛周围皱纹深陷。
en-US: dr michael prager said professionals who worked long hours in front of a screen were ending up with saggy jowls , ' turkey neck' and deep-set wrinkles on their forehead and around their eyes .

zh-CN: 这位肉毒杆菌整容专家表示，在他所有的客户中，办公室女性最易显现出提前衰老的迹象。
en-US: the botox specialist said that , of all his clientele , office workers were most likely to show premature signs of ageing .

zh-CN: 42岁的普拉杰医生说：“如果你在电脑前专心工作时常常蹙眉或眯眼斜视的话，那么很不幸，长此以往，你的面部将不可避免地出现皱纹。”
en-US: ' if you are one of the unfortunate people who frown or squint while they are concentrating at the screen then , over time , you will inevitably end up with frown lines , ' dr prager , 42 , said .

zh-CN: “可能更令人震惊的是，竟然有这么多的女性有面颊下垂的症状，因为她们长时间都保持同一坐姿。”
en-US: ' what is perhaps more surprising is the number of women with saggy jowls because they are sitting in one position for so long .

zh-CN: “如果大多数时间你都埋头俯视状态，颈部肌肉就会萎缩并且变得松弛，最终导致双下巴。
en-US: ' if you spend most of the time looking down then the neck muscles shorten and go saggy , eventually giving you a second neck .

zh-CN: “我们看到许多在办公室里担任管理职务的女性都有这个问题。”在伦敦哈利街附近执业的普拉杰医生建议客户在自己的电脑旁边放置一面镜子，以便能看到自己是否在皱着眉头看电脑。
en-US: ' we are seeing a lot of women who work in executive jobs in offices who have this problem . ' dr prager , who has a practice near harley street in london , said he encourages his clients to put a mirror next to their computer so they can see if they are frowning at the screen .

zh-CN: “当人们压力大，或在努力思考某件事情的时候，常常会摆出一副‘暴躁的面孔’，而自己却意识不到。当我的客户们在自己桌旁摆了镜子以后，她们常常会对镜中瞪着自己的那张愤怒、眉头紧锁的脸感到震惊。”
en-US: ' when people are stressed or thinking hard about something then they will often put on a " grumpy face " without even knowing what they are doing. when my clients put a mirror next to their desk they are often shocked by the angry , frowning face which stares back at them . '

zh-CN: 他告诫说，伴随着信息技术成长起来的年轻一代男女正在出现“电脑脸”，而且呈年轻化趋势。
en-US: he warned that a generation of younger men and women who had grown up with information technology were developing 'computer face' at a much earlier age .

zh-CN: 他说：“目前我所治疗的只是在电脑前工作了十年左右的女性。但是那些20多岁的女孩则是在电脑的陪伴下成长的，她们的每一项工作都离不开电脑。”
en-US: he said : ' the women i am seeing at the moment have only been using computers at work for the last decade or so. but women in their 20 s have grown up with them and use them for every single task .

zh-CN: “对她们来说，情况就会完全不同，而且我认为这个问题将变得更加糟糕。再过十年，她们看起来可能会相当恐怖。”
en-US: ' it will be completely different for them and i think the problem is going to become much , much worse. in another ten years , they could be looking quite awful . '

zh-CN: 普拉杰医生说，有几种简单的方法可以延缓“电脑脸”的到来，诸如定期离开电脑屏幕休息一下，伸展颈部肌肉。
en-US: dr prager said there were several simple steps which could stave off computer face such as regular screen breaks and stretching the neck muscles .

zh-CN: 当然，注射肉毒杆菌也会有作用。
en-US: and , of course , there was always botox .

zh-CN: 他说，经过几个疗程的肉毒杆菌注射，爱摆“暴躁的面孔”这样的坏习惯可能得到改正。
en-US: he said that , after a couple of sessions of botox , the habit of 'grumpy face' could be broken .

zh-CN: 御宅族周末可以做的10件事
en-US: 10 fun things to do on weekends

zh-CN: 又到周末了干什么好呢？
en-US: the weekend ’ s here and you ’ re thinking about your plans .

zh-CN: 下面就为你列出20件周末可以做的事。
en-US: here are 20 fun things to do this weekend .

zh-CN: 其中既有户外型的，又有适合都市人的；不论你是约会，还是欢度家庭时光，都能从中发现不错的活动建议哦！
en-US: this list has ideas for everyone , from the outdoorsy types to the city slickers. perhaps you have a new date , or you want to do something with the family . whatever the case may be , you have lots of great activities from which to choose .

zh-CN: 湖畔漫步
en-US: take a walk around the lake

zh-CN: 跟伴侣或爱犬去湖畔散散步，欣赏风景、伸展胳膊、喂喂鸭子，然后再在湖边小店喝杯冰茶。
en-US: find a lake with a walking path and bring your partner or your canine companion. enjoy the views , get some exercise and feed the ducks. then , stop for some iced tea at the lakeside restaurant .

zh-CN: 去远足
en-US: go on a hike

zh-CN: 许多城市边缘或离市区几英里的位置都有远足的地方。
en-US: many areas have hikes of varying lengths within city limits or a few miles outside of the city itself .

zh-CN: 你可以选择短程但刺激的远足，或花一天时间去登山。
en-US: you can choose shorter , more level hikes or head to the mountains and make it an all-day affair .

zh-CN: 当然，别忘了准备好鞋子、水、防晒霜和帽子。
en-US: don ’ t forget good shoes , water , sunblock , and a hat .

zh-CN: 骑游
en-US: go on a bike ride

zh-CN: 在本地车店租一辆或干脆跨上自己的车去骑游。
en-US: rent a bike from the local bike shop or ride your own .

zh-CN: 先标好路程并算好距离，在手机里设置好骑行导航软件。
en-US: map out a route and calculate the distance using a bicycling app on your smartphone .

zh-CN: 多带点水，别忘了戴上头盔。
en-US: take extra water and don ’ t forget to wear a helmet .

zh-CN: 这项活动也很适合小孩子哦。
en-US: this can be a fun activity for kids , too .

zh-CN: 做有趣的手工活
en-US: start a fun , new weekend craft

zh-CN: 是不是一直想重新装饰房间里那张旧梳妆台？
en-US: you know that old dresser in your room that you ’ ve been wanting to spruce up ?

zh-CN: 那就准备好砂纸、涂料和油漆，开始行动，把它粉饰得漂漂亮亮吧！
en-US: get some sandpaper , wood stain and polyurethane and turn that dresser into a beautiful piece of furniture .

zh-CN: 野餐
en-US: go on a picnic

zh-CN: 带上食物，到当地公园或休闲区痛快玩一天。
en-US: find a local park or recreation area and bring food and games for a day of fun .

zh-CN: 飞盘、马蹄铁、排球、足球或短途远足，随你玩。
en-US: play frisbee , horseshoes , volleyball , soccer , or take a short hike .

zh-CN: 或许你也愿意尝试游泳、钓鱼、划船或躲在舒服的角落看书。
en-US: you might be able to swim or fish , rent a paddle boat , or find a comfortable spot to read a book .

zh-CN: K歌
en-US: go to a karaoke bar

zh-CN: 跟好朋友去KTV唱唱喜欢的歌，同时享用美味的食物和饮料，度过一个开心的夜晚。
en-US: sing to your favorite songs while enjoying the company of good friends. order food , have a beverage and make a night of it .

zh-CN: 读书看电影
en-US: read a book then see the movie

zh-CN: 当你读到一本好书时，很可能发现它也有同名电影。
en-US: when you read a good book , chances are it ’ s turned into a movie .

zh-CN: 像《哈利波特》和《相助》就很受欢迎。
en-US: books like harry potter and the help are recent popular favorites .

zh-CN: 去茶馆坐坐
en-US: go to a tea house

zh-CN: 与其去咖啡馆，不如改去茶馆吧。在茶馆，你可以品尝各种各样的茶，比如散装茶或是来自世界各地的混合花草茶。
en-US: change it up a bit and instead of going for the coffeehouse , look for the tea house. you can sample different teas , try tea in loose leaf form or try out unusual herbal blends from all over the world .

zh-CN: 5千米长跑
en-US: run a 5k

zh-CN: 5千米长跑对保持体形很有帮助。
en-US: running in a 5 k is a great way to get in shape .

zh-CN: 你可以加入慈善机构组织的长跑活动，或自己跑着玩儿。
en-US: often , you can participate for charity or just for fun .

zh-CN: 还有，别忘了让朋友给你加油鼓劲。
en-US: either way , recruit your friends or have them cheer you on .

zh-CN: 另外，有些长跑运动甚至也适合小孩呢。
en-US: there are even 5k ’ s that are kid-friendly .

zh-CN: 商店库存促销时扫货
en-US: shop garage sales

zh-CN: 先看看哪些商家有促销活动，定好路线攻略，然后就集中扫货去吧。
en-US: check your local listings and set up a route to hit a lot of garage sales in one day .

zh-CN: 促销时能买到不少便宜的家具、家用物件或漂亮衣服。
en-US: this is a great opportunity to find furniture , household items and stylish clothes at incredible prices .

zh-CN: 好好玩一玩吧！
en-US: have fun !

zh-CN: 可做的事情这么多，相信你的周末肯定会过得轻松又开心。
en-US: with this list of ideas , you ’ re sure to have plenty to do for a weekend of spontaneity , fun , and relaxation .

zh-CN: 而且说不定你还能学到新东西，比如看一场好玩的话剧，总之你肯定不会无聊的。
en-US: you might learn a few things , see a play you ’ ve never seen , but you definitely won ’t be bored .

zh-CN: 嫁还是不嫁这是个问题
en-US: what singles really what

zh-CN: 最近一则网络广告的情节如下：每当女主角经历大学毕业、求职成功、工作晋升时，年迈多病的外婆嘴边总是挂着同一个问题：“结婚了吧？”；直到广告结尾，女主角身披婚纱冲回家中，终于在外婆临终满足了她最大的心愿。
en-US: a recent online commercial tells the following story : upon graduating , getting a job and being promoted , the female protagonist ’ s grandmother , whose health is in decline , keeps asking her the same question , “ when are you getting married ? ” , until the woman finally rushes home in a wedding dress to bring the elderly lady in her dying days the ultimate comfort .

zh-CN: 婚姻令单身女性们不堪重负，仿佛她们结婚并不是为了自己，而是为了满足他人的期望。
en-US: marriage puts a lot of pressure on single women , as if they are destined to get married in order to fulfill others ’ , rather than their own , expectations .

zh-CN: 然而专家表示，是约定俗成的社会观念以及通过婚姻实现自我认同迫使单身女性早日嫁人，这也造成了当今社会中现代女性的窘境。
en-US: but what ’ s pushing single women into matrimony is a social stereotype and form of self-identification that creates a dilemma for modern women in today ’ s social contexts , experts say .

zh-CN: 在《寻找幸福——不失本心地走过单身的起起落落，并沿路找寻天长地久》一书中，美国作家米歇尔•卡夫试图揭露出女人在感情中真正想要的东西。
en-US: in the book seeking happily ever after : navigating the ups and downs of being single without losing your mind ( and finding lasting love along the way ) , us author michelle cove tries to reveal what women really want out of a relationship .

zh-CN: 在美国女性时尚杂志《嘉人》的一篇报道中，卡夫在对一些单身女性进行深入采访后，将她们分成了如下几类：
en-US: as reported in marie claire , a women ’ s magazine in the us , cove identifies some of the categories of single women based on intensive interviews .

zh-CN: 找寻真爱女
en-US: the soul-mate seeker

zh-CN: 寻找“真爱”成为她们生活中的重中之重。
en-US: finding “ the one ” is the most important task in her life .

zh-CN: 凤凰涅槃女
en-US: the phoenix

zh-CN: 她们竭尽所能要摆脱上一段恋情带来的毁灭性打击，同时想要找回神采奕奕的状态。
en-US: she is doing everything she can to rise from a recent devastating breakup and to be in good shape again .

zh-CN: 有机生活女
en-US: the organic

zh-CN: 她们信奉顺其自然，一切听从命运安排。
en-US: she prefers the “ let it be ” approach and leaves things up to destiny .

zh-CN: 她们用自己的方式生活，而不是按部就班地去刻意寻求伴侣。
en-US: she lives her own life rather than hunting for men in a methodical way .

zh-CN: 自在随风女
en-US: the free spirit

zh-CN: 选择独立还是结束单身？
en-US: independence or a relationship ?

zh-CN: 她们认为两者之间很难妥协，所以最终选择了前者。
en-US: she believes there is no way to reach a compromise between both and therefore leans to the former .

zh-CN: 结婚狂想女
en-US: the wedding wisher

zh-CN: 原本从不考虑结婚的她们突然发现自己幻想着能披上婚纱步入礼堂。
en-US: she suddenly finds herself fantasizing about getting married after a lifetime of not caring about it .

zh-CN: 叛逆不羁女
en-US: the town rebel

zh-CN: 她们不想再去过和周围人一样的平淡生活，尽管她们从前亦是如此。
en-US: she no longer aspires to live the normal lifestyle of everyone else in her community , though she once used to .

zh-CN: 稳扎稳打女
en-US: the slow and steady

zh-CN: 她们希望自己在时机成熟时步入婚姻。
en-US: a woman who hopes to marry when the time is right .

zh-CN: 同时，她们也尽全力摆脱朋友、家庭和社会给自己带来的巨大压力。
en-US: meanwhile , she does her best not to cave to the massive pressure she feels from friends , family and society .

zh-CN: 独辟蹊径女
en-US: the trailblazer

zh-CN: 她们知道婚姻并非自己想要的生活，所以，她们尝试开拓另一种通往幸福的道路。
en-US: a woman who knows married life is not for her , so she ’ s trying to break a new kind of path to happiness .

zh-CN: 这里是美国之音慢速英语新闻杂志，我是马里奥·利特在华盛顿。
en-US: welcome to as it is from voa learning english ! i'm mario ritter in washington .

zh-CN: 今天我们谈谈南亚和公众健康问题，
en-US: today we turn to south asia and the issue of public health .

zh-CN: 疫苗工作使得大多数国家免于脊髓灰质炎感染的风险，
en-US: vaccination efforts have almost ended the risk of polio infection in most countries .

zh-CN: 但世卫组织称这种病毒在巴基斯坦一个大城市仍是一大问题。
en-US: but the world health organization says the virus is still a problem in a major pakistani city .

zh-CN: 世卫组织宣布巴基斯坦城市白沙瓦是全世界最大的脊髓灰质炎病毒来源地，
en-US: the world health organization has declared the pakistani city of peshawar , the world's " largest reservoir " of endemic poliovirus .

zh-CN: 世卫官员担心除非立即采取措施阻止这种疾病的蔓延，否则巴基斯坦人将面临旅行限制。克里斯多夫·克鲁斯报道。
en-US: and who officials fear pakistanis could face travel restrictions unless steps are taken immediately to stop the disease from spreading. christopher cruise has more .

zh-CN: 研究者研究了去年巴基斯坦的全部脊髓灰质炎病例，
en-US: researchers studied all the cases of poliomyelitis in pakistan last year .

zh-CN: 发现几乎每个病例都与白沙瓦经常报道的脊髓灰质炎病毒存在基因上的关联。
en-US: the researchers found that almost every case could be linked genetically to the poliovirus often reported in peshawar .

zh-CN: 他们称从该市各地区收集的实验样本都表明高度感染病毒的存在。
en-US: they added that all test samples collected from different parts of the city have shown the presence of the highly infectious virus .

zh-CN: 脊髓灰质炎主要影响五岁以下儿童。
en-US: polio mainly affects children under five years of age. the virus is passed through food or water .

zh-CN: 这种病毒通过食物和水传播，能在体内繁殖并入侵神经系统。
en-US: the virus reproduces in the body , and later invades the nervous system .

zh-CN: 这种疾病有时导致瘫痪，身体部分地方的肌肉失去控制。
en-US: the disease can sometimes lead to paralysis , with loss of muscle control in part of the body .

zh-CN: 世界组织研究发现，巴基斯坦90%的脊髓灰质炎病例都与白沙瓦的病毒有关联。
en-US: the who study found that 90 percent of pakistan's polio cases could be linked to the virus in peshawar .

zh-CN: 另外，阿富汗每13个病例就有12个与该市有关联。
en-US: in addition , 12 of the 13 polio cases in afghanistan were also linked to the city .

zh-CN: 伊莱亚斯·迪里是世卫组织驻巴基斯坦的脊髓灰质炎紧急协调员，
en-US: elias durry serves as the who's emergency coordinator for polio in pakistan .

zh-CN: 他说当地官员需要采取紧急行动加强疫苗接种活动，
en-US: he says local officials need to take urgent action to strengthen vaccination campaigns .

zh-CN: 他说白沙瓦的情况不仅会威胁巴基斯坦在对抗脊髓灰质炎上的进步，
en-US: he says the situation in peshawar not only threatens the gains pakistan has made against polio ,

zh-CN: 还会影响国际上对抗该疾病的努力。
en-US: but could also harm international efforts to stop the disease .

zh-CN: “除非巴基斯坦的脊髓灰质炎根除计划能遏制住在白沙瓦的传播，
en-US: " unless the polio eradication program in pakistan is able to curtail the transmission in peshawar ,

zh-CN: 这种病毒还会向其他地区传播。
en-US: the expansion of , of the viruses to other places will not stop ,

zh-CN: 所以，关键的是白沙瓦的现行措施能够确实阻断多年来的传播。”
en-US: so it is critical that peshawar , the way it is behaving now , really be able to find ways of interrupting these transmissions that have been consistent throughout the years . "

zh-CN: 他还指出白沙瓦内外和其他地区都出现针对疫苗接种人员的致命袭击。
en-US: he also noted an increase in deadly attacks on vaccination campaign workers in and around peshawar , and in other areas .

zh-CN: 塔利班武装分子经常袭击巴基斯坦的脊髓灰质炎接种人员，
en-US: taliban militants often attack polio workers in pakistan .

zh-CN: 他们指责这些人员是美国的间谍，或是参与阻止穆斯林怀孕的阴谋。
en-US: the militants accuse them of being american spies or part of a plot to keep muslims from having babies .

zh-CN: 大多数袭击发生在白沙瓦，因为该市临近该国的部落地区。
en-US: most of the attacks have taken place in peshawar because the city is close to the country's tribal districts .

zh-CN: 极端组织的总部都在这里。
en-US: extremist groups have bases in those areas .

zh-CN: EliasDurry并不否认，如果不立即改善这一现状，那么其他国家可能对巴基斯坦实施旅行和签证限制。
en-US: elias durry did not reject the possibility of other countries ordering travel and visa restrictions on pakistan if there is no quick improvement in the situation .

zh-CN: 在邻国印度，过去三年没有报道出现脊髓灰质炎病例。
en-US: in neighboring india , no polio cases have been reported for the past three years .

zh-CN: 从这个月开始，所有从巴基斯坦到印度旅行的游客都要出示脊髓灰质炎免疫证明。我是克里斯多夫·克鲁斯。
en-US: starting this month , all visitors to india from pakistan are required to show a record of their polio vaccination.i'm christopher cruise .

zh-CN: 这就是今天的节目，谢谢您的收听。
en-US: and that is our program for today. thank you for joining us .

zh-CN: 告诉我们你想在新闻杂志听到什么，
en-US: let us know what you want to hear on a future as is is .

zh-CN: 贵州省警方表示，他们已经确定了周四发生的公交车致命纵火案的动机，这起案件造成6人死亡。
en-US: police in guizhou province say they have established a motive for thursday's deadly bus arson that killed six people .

zh-CN: 他们表示，孙姓嫌疑人怀疑他妻子有外遇，
en-US: they say the suspect , surnamed su , believed his wife was having an affair ,

zh-CN: 于是他要通过在公交车上点燃汽油来“报复”社会。
en-US: and thus he " took revenge on society " by igniting a barrel of gasoline on the bus .

zh-CN: 这起纵火案造成6人死亡，其中有一名年仅4个月的男婴。
en-US: a four month old boy is among the six people killed .

zh-CN: 另有35人在火灾中受伤。
en-US: 35 others were injured .

zh-CN: 救援人员表示，火热蔓延得非常快。
en-US: survivors say the flames spread quickly .

zh-CN: 嫌疑人在火灾中受了轻伤，他已经于周五被正式逮捕。
en-US: the suspect was slightly injured in the fire - he was formally arrested on friday .

en-US: the chinese government has taken a major step to improve the competitiveness of the nation's oil and gas exploration sector .

zh-CN: 该行业的一些关键设备已经加入中国的免税名单，
en-US: a variety of equipment vital to the industry has been added to china's duty-free list ,

zh-CN: 包括钻孔设备、半潜式钻井平台、液化天然气船
en-US: including drilling equipment , semi-submersible drilling rigs , liquified natural gas carriers ,

zh-CN: 以及其他在勘探中必需的设备和高端制造厂。
en-US: and several other pieces vital to exploration and high-end manufactoring .

zh-CN: 这项措施将于周日生效。
en-US: the measure takes effect on saturday .

zh-CN: 你离周五只剩下一天了。
en-US: you're only a day away from friday .

zh-CN: 欢迎收看CNN学生新闻。
en-US: you're watching cnn student news .

zh-CN: 你离来做自己的事情还有10分钟的时间。
en-US: you're ten minutes away from getting up to speed on current events .

zh-CN: 我们今天首先从中国开始。
en-US: we are starting in china today .

zh-CN: 那里正在召开重大会议。
en-US: big meeting there .

zh-CN: 它就是一年一次的全国人民代表大会。
en-US: it's the once a year gathering of the national people's congress .

zh-CN: 它包括成千上万来自全国各地的代表们。
en-US: it includes thousands of delegates from all over the country .

zh-CN: 中国是一个共产主义国家。
en-US: china is a communist state .

zh-CN: 政府掌握经济和社会的其他部分。
en-US: the government controls the economy and other parts of society .

zh-CN: 它不会就任何重大法律进行投票。
en-US: it won't be voting on any major laws .

zh-CN: 但这次会议对中国来说是个来谈论其经济计划的机会。
en-US: but this meeting is a chance for china to talk about its economic plans .

zh-CN: 而且因为它是世界第二大经济体,国际经济学家都在关注这个国家。
en-US: and because it's the world's second largest economy , international economists are watching to see what china will do .

zh-CN: 国际社会也正在关注乌克兰。
en-US: other parts of the international community are watching ukraine .

zh-CN: 很多人谈到了昨天的危机。
en-US: a lot of talking about the crisis there yesterday .

zh-CN: 会议涉及欧盟、乌克兰、俄罗斯、美国的官员,但没有大的举措。
en-US: meetings involving officials from the european union , ukraine , russia , the u.s. , but there wasn't a lot of action .

zh-CN: 一些美国官员仍在考虑经济制裁入侵乌克兰的俄罗斯。
en-US: some u.s. officials are still considering economic sanctions against russian for its involvement in ukraine .

zh-CN: 而俄罗斯威胁自己的经济活动可能会影响到欧洲其他地区的贸易。
en-US: russia's threatening economic action of its own that could hurt trade in other parts of europe .

zh-CN: 你没有看到,你没感觉到。
en-US: you didn't see it , you didn't feel it .

zh-CN: 你可能不知道它在那里。
en-US: you might not have known it was there .

zh-CN: 但是我们昨天同一颗小行星擦身而过。
en-US: but an asteroid zipped by us yesterday .

zh-CN: 嗯,这是相对的。
en-US: well , that's relative .

zh-CN: 它是空间标准的擦身而过,而不是英里。
en-US: it was close by space standards , it wasn't in terms of miles .

zh-CN: 但10000次中有一次，同样的小行星会再次来到我们的地球附近，确切日期是2046年的3月4日，乍得·迈尔斯会帮助我们了解。
en-US: but since there is a one in 10,000 chance of this same asteroid coming back near us , on march 4 , 2046 , chad myers is going to help us get to know it .

zh-CN: 乍得。
en-US: chad .

zh-CN: 嘿，卡尔，一颗小行星昨天在地球和月球之间掠过，或者至少在月球的轨道。
en-US: hey , carl , an asteroid yesterday flew between the earth and the moon , or at least the orbit of the moon .

zh-CN: 地球到月球之间大约25万英里。
en-US: it's about a quarter of a million miles between the earth to the moon .

zh-CN: 这是里面的详细情况。
en-US: and this was slightly inside of it .

zh-CN: 90%,从这里到这里，或者从这里到这里10%。
en-US: 90 percent , all the way from here to here , or ten percent from here to here .

zh-CN: 所以，当它擦身而过离我们的地球还有217000英里远。
en-US: so , it was still about 2 17,000 miles away as it flew on by the earth .

zh-CN: 现在，让我们考虑它的大小。
en-US: now , let ' s think about the size of this .

zh-CN: 因为这里有个棒球内场。
en-US: because here's the baseball diamond right here .

zh-CN: 实际上这是比赛场地。
en-US: here's actually the tournament field .

zh-CN: 如果你把一个球—一块大石头，你把它放在内野，就是这颗小行星的尺寸。
en-US: if you take a ball of-a big rock and you put it right over the infield , that's how big this asteroid was .

zh-CN: 任何棒球内场的内野。
en-US: right over the infield of any baseball diamond .

zh-CN: 现在，你让它在地球和月球之间飞过。
en-US: now , you take that , you fly that in between the earth and the moon .

zh-CN: 而你得做些什么。
en-US: and you have something going for it .

zh-CN: 现在，这不是更近的，今年可能还会有。
en-US: now , this is not one of the closer ones probably will have this year .

zh-CN: 但它肯定是90%的地球和月球之间，而它被称为DX-110。
en-US: but it certainly is 90 percent of the way between the earth and the moon , and it's called dx-110 .

zh-CN: 叫它110是因为实际上这是今年迄今为止发现的第110颗小行星。
en-US: 110 because it's actually the hundred and tenth asteroid that they have found so far this year .

zh-CN: 牙科X光
en-US: dental x-rays

zh-CN: 请不要太频繁,一点就好
en-US: little and not often , please

zh-CN: 已证实牙科X光对你是有危害的
en-US: confirmation that dental x-rays can be bad for you

zh-CN: 尽管牙科X光实施程序的安全已得到了证实，牙医和技工们还是会在拍X光时离开房间。如果你是一个多疑的人，这样的事实可能会困扰你。
en-US: if you are a suspicious type you may be disturbed by the fact that , despite reassurances of the safety of the procedure , dentists and their technicians , when administering x-rays , usually step out of the room while the deed is done .

zh-CN: 不但如此，在拍X光时他们还经常用铅衬的围裙盖住你的身体以保护重要器官—但是是除了大脑以外的所有器官。
en-US: not only that , they often drape a lead-lined apron over your body to protect your vital organs. well , all but one : your brain .

zh-CN: 耶鲁大学的伊丽莎白.克劳斯医生的一项研究结果刚在癌症杂志上发表。此项研究表明你的怀疑可能并非杞人忧天。
en-US: a study by elizabeth claus , of yale university , just published in cancer , suggests your suspicions might be justified .

zh-CN: 克劳斯医认为她已发现那些经常拍牙科X光的病人得脑瘤的风险确实有显著升高。
en-US: dr claus thinks she has identified , in those who have had dental x-rays often , a significant rise in the admittedly small risk of developing a brain tumour .

zh-CN: 在富裕的国家里，每200，000人中就有5名男性得一种叫脑脊膜瘤的脑瘤，此瘤破坏脑膜，而且发病的女性人数是男性的两倍。
en-US: in rich countries , five men in every 200,000 , and twice as many women , develop tumours called meningiomas that affect the membranes surrounding the brain .

zh-CN: 脑脊膜瘤的患者占原发性脑瘤患者的三分之一。
en-US: meningiomas account for a third of primary brain tumours .

zh-CN: 只有2%的脑脊膜瘤是恶性的，但是非恶性并不代表没有危险。
en-US: only about 2% of them are malignant , but non-malignant does not mean non-dangerous .

zh-CN: 即使是良性的脑脊膜瘤也会至死。
en-US: even a benign meningioma can kill .

zh-CN: 大约30%的至死病例是发生在确诊后5年。
en-US: around 30% do so within five years of diagnosis .

zh-CN: 这种脑瘤的症状包括:痉挛和失明，可以通过手术，化疗，或者用放射疗法来进行治疗。
en-US: symptoms can include seizures and blindness , and treatment may involve surgery , chemotherapy or , ironically , radiotherapy .

zh-CN: 讽刺的是，对人体暴露于类似原子弹辐射和癌症放射疗法的后果的研究显示，产生脑脊膜瘤的最主要的环境风险因素是离子辐射。
en-US: ironically , because past research studying the after-effects of exposure to things like atom bombs and radiation treatments for cancer suggests the most important environmental risk factor for meningiomas is ionising radiation .

zh-CN: 然而，现今影响大多数人的离子辐射的主要源头既不是原子弹的辐射尘埃也不是放射疗法，而是牙科X光。
en-US: these days , however , the main source of ionising radiation for most people is neither fallout from bombs nor radiotherapy ; it is dental x-rays .

zh-CN: 尽管如此，令人惊讶的是几乎没有牙科X光对人类影响的研究。
en-US: despite that , surprisingly little research has been done on those x-rays' effects .

zh-CN: 克劳斯医生和她的同事们已在努力填补这一空白。
en-US: dr claus and her colleagues have tried to plug the gap .

zh-CN: 他们研究了1433名美国的脑脊膜瘤患者，并把他们与1350名非患者进行对比。
en-US: they studied 1,433 americans who have had meningiomas and compared them with 1,350 others who have not .

zh-CN: 这些被选择的非患者构成符合研究所需的年龄组成，性别比例和所在居住地。
en-US: these others were chosen to match the study group's age profile , sex ratio and dwelling place .

zh-CN: 研究人员获取了这两组研究对象的家庭，病史，和牙病史的数据。
en-US: the researchers then inquired about both groups' family , medical and dental histories .

zh-CN: 对于牙病史，参与者被问及他们是否通常每年接受常规的牙医X光，或是从没拍过，或是介于以上两者之间。
en-US: in the case of their dental histories , participants were asked whether they generally had standard x-rays , known as bitewings , every year , or never had them , or fell somewhere in between .

zh-CN: 他们还被问及拍全颌x光—对整个口腔拍摄X光的经常性，以及是否做过牙齿整形—通常是会要求拍全颌x光。
en-US: they were also asked how often they had had panoramic x-rays—so-called panorexes — taken of their entire mouths , and whether they had ever had braces , the fitting of which often involves a panoramic x-ray .

zh-CN: 研究发现患脑脊膜瘤的病人发病的可能性是那些没拍过咬翼片的人的两倍以上。
en-US: the researchers found that people who had had a meningioma were more than twice as likely as those who had not to have had at least one bitewing x-ray .

zh-CN: 拍咬翼片次数越多的人，可能性越大。
en-US: and the more bitewings they had been given , the greater that likelihood was .

zh-CN: 更让人担忧的发现是十岁以下拍过全颌x光的人患脑脊膜瘤的概率是正常风险值的4.9倍。
en-US: even more troubling was the finding that people who had been given a panorex when they were under ten had 4.9 times the normal risk of developing a meningioma .

zh-CN: 公平地说，只有22名研究参与者拍过全颌x光并患有脑脊膜瘤。
en-US: to be fair , only 22 participants in the study had both had a panorex and developed such a tumour .

zh-CN: 但据克劳斯医生说，以前研究对象大部分是儿童，拍全颌x光的现象并不普遍。
en-US: but according to dr claus , the panorex was not common when most of the people in the study had been children .

zh-CN: 如今，她说，在牙齿整形之前所有儿童都拍过全颌x光了。
en-US: nowadays , she says , before getting braces all the kids have it .

zh-CN: 以上研究发现的实际意义还是有争议的。
en-US: what these results mean in practice is debatable .

zh-CN: 克劳斯医生指出，单次牙医X光的辐射剂量已在过去的30年降低到原来的一半左右。
en-US: the radiation dose from an individual dental x-ray , dr claus points out , has gone down by about half over the past 30 years or so .

zh-CN: 另外，一些牙科医生和整牙医师—虽然并不占多数，已转用电子手段，这就更大程度的降低了病人所受的辐射程度。
en-US: in addition , some dentists and orthodontists — though far from the majority — have turned to digital methods that expose patients to even lower levels. but others are using fancy new techniques like cone-beam computerised tomography which actually expose people to much higher levels of radiation .

zh-CN: 此外，美国牙科协会的指南规定健康成年人每两到三年不应拍超过一次的咬翼片，并且没有理由给无病症的病人拍X光。
en-US: moreover , guidelines from the american dental association state that healthy adults should have a bitewing x-ray no more than once every two or three years , and that there is little reason to x-ray patients who do not have symptoms .

zh-CN: 克劳斯医生认为这些政策是很合理的。
en-US: these are policies which dr claus describes as quite reasonable .

zh-CN: 如果研究参与者所告知的都是事实的话，可见并不是所有牙科医生都留心自身的建议。
