en-US: mr kerry said in response to a question about a second adiz in the south china sea : “ with respect to the adiz we have indeed made clear our feelings about any unilateral announcements and i reiterated that again today. and i hope that whatever follows in the future will be done in an open transparent and accountable way . ”

zh-CN: 防空识别区要求进入相关空域的外国飞机报告自己的身份，中国官员强调称，它不是一种领土要求。
en-US: an adiz requires foreign aircraft entering the airspace to identify themselves , and chinese officials have stressed it is not a territorial claim .

zh-CN: 但中国人民大学国际关系学院教授时殷弘表示，划设防空识别区“可能间接支持领土要求”。
en-US: but shi yinhong , a professor of international relations at renmin university in beijing , said the creation of the zone “ may indirectly support territorial claims ” .

zh-CN: 继上月批评中国的防空识别区之后，美国在本月早些时候再度点名批评中国的领土要求。美国国务院亚太事务助理国务卿丹尼•罗素在国会作证时表示，中国对南海大片海域的主权主张——即所谓的“九段线”是“有根本缺陷的”。
en-US: following criticism of the adiz last month , the us again singled out china ’ s territorial claims earlier this month when daniel russel , assistant secretary of state , said in testimony to the us congress that china ’ s claim to much of the south china sea , known as the “ nine dash line ” , was “ fundamentally flawed ” .

zh-CN: 这是美国首次明确挑战中国的这一主张。
en-US: it was the first time the us has explicitly challenged the chinese claim .

zh-CN: 据中国官方的新华社报道，中国外长王毅上周五对克里表示，他希望美国能够尊重中国的“主权权益”，“客观公正地看待有关问题”，切实不选边站队。
en-US: wang yi , chinese foreign minister , told mr kerry on friday that he hoped the us would respect china ’ s “ sovereign rights ” , “ treat the issue objectively and fairly ” and not take sides , the official xinhua news agency reported .

zh-CN: 目前北京方面态度强硬，因为很多中国人相信，他们有权掌控自身在西太平洋的环境。
en-US: tempers in beijing are frayed because many chinese believe they have the right to assert control of their environment in the western pacific .

zh-CN: 中国南海研究院院长吴士存表示：“我不认为美国在这个问题上有干涉权；美国正试图利用南海作为一种工具来遏制中国。”
en-US: wu shicun , director of the south china sea institute , said : “ i don ’t think the us has a right to interfere in the issue ; the us is trying to use the south china sea as a vehicle to contain china . ”

zh-CN: 录制这期节目时，奥斯卡颁奖典礼即将在洛杉矶开幕。
en-US: as we record this podcast , the oscars are about to get underway in la .

en-US: it seems there is no limit to what celebrities will do to look their best during the hollywood ’ s glamorous award season .

en-US: but beauty treatments of all kinds are big business in the us and not just for the stars .

en-US: according to the american society of plastic surgeons ,

en-US: bbc ’ s lee pattison met two los angles doctors to see how treatments could actually help stars reveal the best versions of themselves .

en-US: deep breath. exhale slowly . ” lodie richards gets her blood drawn for what is in the office a routine beauty treatment .

en-US: how was that ? ” painless . ” doctor mark darrel oversees one nearly everyday .

en-US: la is cosmetic city. there ’ s no question about it .

en-US: we have people who come in who have to beg , borrow and steal , but they are doing the ‘ vampire face-lift ’ . ”

zh-CN: 该手术要用患者自己的血液，因此才有了这个瘆人的名字。
en-US: the sinister name comes from the fact that the procedure uses the patients ’ own blood .

zh-CN: 奥斯卡颁奖典礼之前，这种手术特别受欢迎，因为它是无创手术，而且术后恢复快。
en-US: it ’ s an especially popular pre-oscars treatment because it ’ s non-invasive with little recovery time .

en-US: and doctor darrel sees results. biopsies have been done and we have actually seen new tissue growth .

zh-CN: 这不是简单的化妆新潮流，而是一种崭新的整容术。”如果你长得好看，你就像变得更漂亮一些。
en-US: this is not just a mania of cosmetics. this is the new face-lift . ” you look good. you wanna look better .

zh-CN: 这个城市就是这样。”梅尔·金斯伯格是《好莱坞报道》杂志时尚版资深作家。
en-US: that ’ s what this town is all about . ” merle ginsberg is the senior style writer at the hollywood reporter .

zh-CN: 她说，一些看似极端的整容手术都发源于洛杉矶。
en-US: she says beauty trans that seem extreme often start here .

zh-CN: 影视明星、歌手，谁能比他们更有钱？见识得更多？
en-US: who has more money and access than people in films and television and music ?

zh-CN: 这是第一点。第二，他们有变美的动力。因为他们要靠脸吃饭。”
en-US: no.1. no. 2 , they have the pressure to look good. it ’ s part of how much they make for a living . ”

en-US: here in beverly hills i ’m standing on rodeo drive .

en-US: this world famous street is filled with fancy cars and designer stores like cartier and channel .

en-US: and this neighborhood , one of the most exclusive in los angles is home to actors , musicians and stars of all sorts

zh-CN: 同时，还有使他们美貌长存的人。”梅尔·金斯伯格说道：

en-US: the quest for beauty is very very humane and really it ’ s to me about the quest for love and attention and approval and validation .

zh-CN: 我是杰姬·伦纳德，通过BBC“全球服务”栏目，为您带来今天的新闻要点。
en-US: i ’m jackie leonard with a selection of highlights from across bbc world service news today .

zh-CN: 这次新闻的主要内容有：俄罗斯和乌克兰出现僵持局面，
en-US: coming up , an uneasy calm prevails in crimea amid military standoff between russia and ukraine .

zh-CN: 克里米亚虽然暂时平静，但局面还是令人不安。同时，俄罗斯总统普京坚称，他仍然认为遭驱逐的总统亚努科维奇才是乌克兰的合法领导人。
en-US: meanwhile , in moscow president putin insists he still recognizes ukraine ’ s ousted president viktor yanukovych as the legitimate leader .

zh-CN: “显然，他没有任何权力了，这个可以理解。
en-US: “ it ’ s clear he doesn't have any power . that ’ s understandable .

zh-CN: 我想重申，从法律意义上讲，亚努科维奇才是国家的合法领导人。”
en-US: i want to repeat that the legitimate president in purely legal terms is of course yanukovych . ”

zh-CN: 那么，这将对美国务卿与乌克兰现任领导人的基辅会谈有何影响呢？
en-US: so what impact might this have for the us secretary of states meeting in kief with those who replaced him ?

zh-CN: 另外，法国科学家救活了长眠地下三万余年的古老病毒。
en-US: also in this podcast , an ancient virus has been brought back to life by french scientists after lying dormant for at least 30,000 years .

zh-CN: 我们还将听到二战时期日本“神风”敢死队给亲人留下的遗书。
en-US: and we ’ll hear about the last letters written by japanese kamikaze pilots to their loved ones during the world war ii .

zh-CN: “亲爱的母亲：我最大的遗憾就是在有生之年不能为您尽孝。
en-US: “ dear mother , my one regret is i could not do more for you before i die .

zh-CN: 但是为天皇战死是光荣的，我欣然前往。不要为我感到悲伤。”
en-US: but to die as a fighter for the emperor is an honor . it is something you can feel happy about . do not feel sad . ”

zh-CN: 气候变化会唤醒沉睡数千年的致命病毒吗？
en-US: could climate change unleash deadly viruses that have lain dormant for thousands of years .

zh-CN: 这是有可能发生的。
en-US: it ’ s possible according to a group of french scientists

zh-CN: 法国科学家首次唤醒了长眠于西伯利亚永冻土中三万余年的古老病毒。
en-US: who have for the first time revived an ancient virus that have been buried in siberian permafrost for 30,000 years .

zh-CN: 所幸，他们发现的病毒不会对人类造成致命的伤害，但可以伤害用于实验的变形虫。
en-US: fortunately , the one they found wasn't deadly to humans but it did cause some nasty damage to an amoeba they tested it on .

zh-CN: 我们的科学记者瑞贝卡·莫雷勒就此进行了采访。
en-US: our science reporter rebecca morelle spoke about the findings .

zh-CN: “这绝对是一项了不起的研究。
en-US: “ it ’ s an absolutely incredible piece of research .

zh-CN: 该病毒被发现于西伯利亚永冻土中，距地平面约30米。
en-US: so the viruses was found varied about 30 meters down in the siberian permafrost .

zh-CN: 而且，三万年来悄无声息，没有活跃迹象。
en-US: and it ’ s been lying there dormant , not doing anything for the last 30,000 years .

zh-CN: 这病毒也奇怪得很，非常大。
en-US: it ’ s also quite a weird virus , too. it ’ s very big in size .

zh-CN: 透过显微镜，你能看得很清楚。这也是科学家们第一次发现并救活如此古老的病毒。”
en-US: you can actually see it under a microscope , which is really unusual for a virus and it ’ s the biggest scientists have found so old and revived . ”

zh-CN: “我们能控制住它吗?””可以，好在它并不影响人类和动物的生存。
en-US: “ and it ’ s under control or not ? ” “ yes. so the good news is this doesn't actually affect humans or animals .

zh-CN: 但是科学家担心，永冻土深处可能还隐藏着更多致命的病毒，比如天花。
en-US: but scientists all worried that there could be more deadly viruses lurking down there in the deep place at the permafrost , smallpox for example .

zh-CN: 天花产生与几千年前，现在，从表面上看已经被根除，但很有可能已渗透到深层土壤。”
en-US: that was around thousands of years ago. it ’ s eradicated now on the surface , but there is a chance if those deep places were penetrated . ”

zh-CN: 苏·蒙哥马利为你播报BBC新闻。
en-US: bbc news with sue montgomery

zh-CN: 报道称据悉是俄罗斯士兵的武装人员和乌克兰军队在克里米亚城市塞瓦斯托波尔外发生了紧张的对峙，
en-US: there are reports of a tense standoff between armed men believed to be russian soldiers and ukrainian forces at a base just outside the crimean city of sevastopol .

zh-CN: 克里斯蒂安·弗雷泽在基地外报道。
en-US: christian fraser has been outside the base .

zh-CN: 我们去过现场，看来基地发生了很激烈的情况，
en-US: we've been to , looks like a very tense situation at the base .

zh-CN: 有两辆属于黑海舰队的卡车在大门外行驶着，
en-US: there are two trucks that belong to the black sea fleet , it has been maneuvering in front of the gates ,

zh-CN: 所以我们不知道他们想做什么，有一群人看起来很有恶意，
en-US: so we don't know what they're trying to do , and there is a crowd of sort of people there who are pretty hostile , um ,

zh-CN: 然后有群记者从车里出来开始拍照片，
en-US: we understand that some journalists get out of the car and take photographs ,

zh-CN: 现在我们得到的报道称他们可能挨打了，所以我们努力晚点出现，看起来情况不妙。你能想象出乌克兰士兵一定进去了，
en-US: now our report say they've probably been beaten , so we try to keep a very late presence , it looks quite a tense situation , you can imagine what the ukrainian soldiers must have been going through inside ,

zh-CN: 因为现在大门仍然锁着，但是基地里没有迹象表明他们已经开进那个大门了。
en-US: because at the moment , the gates are still locked , but there is no sign of the base , that we ' ve been to that they've driven through that gates .

zh-CN: 俄罗斯议员们站起来向来自克里米亚的政客代表团致以热烈的鼓掌，
en-US: russian parliamentarians have given a standing ovation to a delegation of politicians from crimea ,

zh-CN: 承诺如果他们想成为俄罗斯的一部分，将会提供帮助。
en-US: promising support if they wanted to become part of russia .

zh-CN: 数千人在莫斯科集会支持政府在克里米亚的行动。理查德·加尔潘在游行现场外报道。
en-US: thousands of people have rallied in moscow in support of the government' s moves in crimea. richard galpin was out the demonstration .

zh-CN: 今天，数千人参加了莫斯科克里姆林宫外的集会，支持政府准备兼并克里米亚的计划。
en-US: today , thousands of people attended a rally outside the kremlin here in moscow in support of the government's plan to annex crimea .

zh-CN: 在附近的议会上，议员们早早地给了克里米亚政客代表团热烈的欢迎，这些议员们准备在9天内就该地区进行公投。
en-US: in parliament nearby , mps had earlier given a warm welcome to a delegation of crimean politicians who are now putting in place plans for a referendum in the region in just nine days time .

zh-CN: 假设投票支持克里米亚成为俄罗斯的一部分，
en-US: assuming the vote is in favor of becoming part of russia ,

zh-CN: 那么几天后，俄罗斯议会就会开始进行讨论立法使得该决定合法化。
en-US: then a few days later , the russian parliament will start debating legislation to try to make it legal .

zh-CN: 就克里米亚来说，当地原住民鞑靼人对加入俄罗斯的前景感到越来越不安，
en-US: in crimean itself , there is a growing unease among the regions of indigenous tatar population at the prospect of joining russia .

zh-CN: BBC记者称看到拿着棒球棒的光头青年在鞑靼人房屋上画十字。
en-US: a bbc correspondent in the town of b says skinheads with baseball bats have been seen marking tatars' houses with crosses .

zh-CN: 法国一家报纸称发现有证据表明前总统尼古拉·萨科齐试图篡改司法系统，
en-US: a french newspaper says it's uncovered evidence , suggesting that the former president nicolas sarkozy tried to tamper with the judicial system .

zh-CN: 世界报称当萨科齐的电话遭窃听时这件事便曝光了。休·斯科菲尔德报道。
en-US: le monde says the allegations came to light when mr . sarkozy's phone was tapped . hugh schofield reports .

zh-CN: 这件事挺复杂，其关键在于显然去年萨科齐的电话遭到窃听。
en-US: a complicated affair this , the central point of which is that for the last year , mr. sarkozy has apparently had his phone tapped .

zh-CN: 根据世界报的报道，调查者从电话窃听中发现，萨科齐从上诉法院的一位高级检察官那里获取有关各种调查的内部消息，
en-US: according to le monde newspaper , what investigators discovered from the phone taps was that mr. sarkozy was getting inside information about various inquiries from a senior prosecutor at the appeals court ,

zh-CN: 据悉这位检察官已近退休，他想得到摩纳哥国务委员的职务，这就是提供内部信息的交换条件，
en-US: this prosecutor , it's claimed , nearing retirement , wanted a job as a state councillor in the monaco and in return for his help ,

zh-CN: 萨科齐私下采取步骤来获得该职位。
en-US: mr. sarkozy personally took steps to try to secure that job .

zh-CN: 萨科齐否认所有指控，他的律师称电话窃听是非法的。BBC新闻报道。
en-US: mr. sarkozy denies all the allegations. and his lawyer says the phone taps were illegal.world news from the bbc

zh-CN: 土耳其前军事首脑伊尔凯尔·巴什布曾因阴谋推翻政府被判终身监禁，现在他已获释。
en-US: the former turkish military chief , ilker basbug has been released from a life sentence , imposed for conspiring to overthrow the government .

zh-CN: 他在电视讲话中说土耳其已经明白他和其他获罪官员与阴谋政变毫无关系，
en-US: in a televised statement , he said the turkish nation had understood that he and other convicted officers had nothing to do with plotting coups .

zh-CN: 他呼吁追究那么将他囚禁两年的人的司法责任。记者在伊斯坦布尔报道。
en-US: he called for justice against those who'd had him locked up for more than two years. from istanbul s g reports .

zh-CN: 在土耳其所谓的土耳其右翼组织审判中，数十名高级官员、律师和记者入狱，伊尔凯尔·巴什布获释是这件事的转折点。
en-US: general basbug's release could prove a turning point in the so-called ergenekon trials in turkey which have seen dozens of senior officers , lawyers and journalists jailed .

zh-CN: 伊尔凯尔·巴什布去年被判阴谋推翻政府，
en-US: general basbug was convicted of plotting to overthrow the government last year .

zh-CN: 但是周四，土耳其最高法院决定遵循正确的审判程序。
en-US: but on thursday , turkey's top court decided that the correct trial procedures had been followed .

zh-CN: 这些审判被视为总理雷杰普·塔伊普·埃尔多安意在打击土耳其强大的武装部队的长期斗争的一部分。
en-US: the trials were seen as part of a long-running battle by the prime minister recep tayyip erdogan to tame turkey's powerful armed forces .

zh-CN: 来自外交方面的消息称南非驱逐了与本周早些时候一场袭击有关的三名卢旺达外交官，袭击当时发生在一名被流放的卢旺达异见人士家。
en-US: diplomatic sources say south africa has expelled three rwandan diplomats in connection with an attack earlier this week on the home of an exiled rwandan dissident .

zh-CN: 案发时将军尼瓦萨不在家中，
en-US: general kayumba nyamwasa was not at his home at the time .

zh-CN: 房屋被破坏，一台电脑和部分文件被带走。
en-US: the property was damaged and a computer and some documents were taken .

zh-CN: 据悉卢旺达驱逐了6名南非外交官作为应对，
en-US: rwanda has reportedly expelled six south african diplomats in response .

zh-CN: 早些时候尼瓦萨将军在南非中弹，但幸免于难。
en-US: general nyamwasa was earlier shot in south africa but survived the attack .

zh-CN: 肯尼亚总统乌胡鲁·肯雅塔宣布他和他的内阁将削减政府人员的工资单，
en-US: the kenyan president uhuru kenyatta has announced that he and his cabinet will take a pay cut to bring down the government's wage bill .

zh-CN: 总统肯雅塔称他和副手的薪水将削减20%，
en-US: president kenyatta said that he and his deputy will take a 20% cut in salary ,

zh-CN: 记者称在肯尼亚政客的薪水是很敏感的话题。
en-US: correspondents say the issue of politician's pay is a highly sensitive one in kenya .

zh-CN: 沙特将穆斯林兄弟会列为恐怖组织，
en-US: saudi arabia has designated the muslim brotherhood a terrorist organization .

zh-CN: 在叙利亚与叛军一起作战的两个圣战组织努斯拉阵线和“伊拉克伊斯兰国家和黎凡特”被内政部列为恐怖组织，
en-US: two jihadist groups fighting in the rebel side in syria , the nusra front and the islamic state of iraq and the levant were also named as terrorist groups by the interior ministry .

zh-CN: 穆斯林兄弟会已经在沙特遭禁。
en-US: the muslim brotherhood is already banned in saudi arabia .

zh-CN: 据悉一架从吉隆坡飞往北京的马来西亚航班失踪已经失踪近24小时，
en-US: it's been almost 24 hours since a malaysian airlines flight from kuala lumpur to beijing was reported missing .

zh-CN: 尽管进行了空中和海上搜索，但尚未迹象表明究竟发生了什么。
en-US: but there's still no indication of what happened , despite an air in sea search .

zh-CN: 早些时候有报道称越南海域出现两处明显的漏油现象，但还未得到证实。
en-US: earlier reports of two apparent oil slicks sighted off the vietnamese coast have not been confirmed .

zh-CN: 机上239名乘客大多是中国人，
en-US: most of the 239 people aboard the plane were chinese .

zh-CN: 旅客名单不符使得有的分析家猜测可能是恐怖袭击，
en-US: discrepancies on the passenger manifest have let some analysts to speculate about a possible terrorist attack .

zh-CN: 记者约翰·萨德沃思在北京报道。
en-US: here's john sudworth with more from beijing .

zh-CN: 由于有150多名中国公民在机上，外长王毅告诉记者该事件已经列为国家紧急事件。
en-US: with more than 150 chinese nationals on board , the foreign minister wang yi told reporters that it was being treated as a national emergency .

zh-CN: 据悉旅客名单上有两人现在安全无恙，
en-US: two men named as being on the passenger list are in fact reported to be safe and well .

zh-CN: 一个是奥地利人，一个是意大利人，据悉这两人前几年在泰国旅行时护照被盗。
en-US: one austrian and one italian and both were said to have had their passports stolen while travelling in thailand in recent years .

zh-CN: 如果证实确实有人拿这些护照登记，那么就有重大的意义。
en-US: if it is confirmed that those passports were used to board the plane , then it would of course be a potentially significant lead .

zh-CN: 美国警告俄罗斯任何兼并克里米亚的举动都会导致停止外交。
en-US: the united states has warned russia that any moves to annex crimea would close the door to diplomacy .

zh-CN: 美国国务卿约翰·克里在电话中告诉俄罗斯外长谢尔盖-拉夫罗夫，
en-US: in a telephone conversation , the american secretary of state john kerry has told his russian counterpart sergei lavrov

zh-CN: 克里米亚是乌克兰的一部分，莫斯科应避免军事升级。
en-US: that crimea is part of ukraine and the moscow should avoid military escalation .

zh-CN: 总统奥巴马已与世界各国领袖商谈已在加深的问及，
en-US: president obama has been discussing the deepening crisis with world leaders .

zh-CN: 来自欧洲安全与合作组织的50多名国际观察员像之前几次那样在试图进入克里米亚时遭到亲俄罗斯准军事部队的拦截，只好原路返回。
en-US: more than 50 international observers from the organization for security and cooperation in europe have been turned back as they tried to enter crimea , as in previous occasions , they were stopped by pro-russia paramilitaries .

zh-CN: 本·布朗在塞瓦斯托波尔报道。
en-US: ben brown is in sevastopol .

zh-CN: 这是国际观察员小组第三天试图越过边境进入克里米亚，但都原路返回。
en-US: this was the third day running the team of international observers had tried to cross the border into crimea ,

zh-CN: 不过这次还遭遇到威胁，
en-US: and the third day running , they've been turned back. this time though , there were some additional menace in the air .

zh-CN: 阻止他们的武装人员向他们开枪，并警告称要用自动步枪。
en-US: the armed men who stopped them fired warning burst of automatic gunfire .

zh-CN: 尽管开枪只是为警告，
en-US: the fact of shots were fired , albeit as a warning ,

zh-CN: 但可能会被视为是俄罗斯对克里米亚的藐视，也是在国际社会脸上扇了一掌。
en-US: is likely to be seen as another show of russian defiance in crimea and another slap in the face for the international community .

zh-CN: 对于苏丹达尔富尔地区最近暴力升级，美国称深感忧虑。
en-US: the untied states says it's deeply concerned about what is described as the recent escalation of violence in the sudanese region of darfur .

zh-CN: 目前喀土穆方面尚未有所表态，非洲编辑玛丽·哈伯报道。
en-US: there's been no word so far from khartoum . here's our africa editor mary harper .

zh-CN: 美国国务院在声明中称，与政府结盟的民兵最近在尼亚拉附近烧毁房屋，袭击平民，使得数千人逃离家园。
en-US: in a statement , the us state department said government-allied militias had recently burned homes and attacked civilians near the town of nyala , causing thousands of people to flee .

zh-CN: 美国称苏丹空军参与其中，并敦促喀土穆停止对达尔富尔地区的轰炸。
en-US: the us said the sudanese air force had been involved , and urged khatoum to stop its campaign of aerial bombardments in darfur .

zh-CN: 美国称达尔富尔人已经遭受不安定、暴力和残暴太久了，
en-US: the us said the people of darfur have suffered insecurity , violence and atrocities for far too long

zh-CN: 现在是通过和平途径终结暴力的时候了。BBC世界新闻。
en-US: and that now was the time for peaceful resolution to the violence . world news from the bbc

zh-CN: 叙利亚政府称在在与黎巴嫩接壤附近将一个城镇从叛军手中夺回，这是努力阻断叛军供应线行动的一部分。塞巴斯蒂安·亚瑟报道。
en-US: the syrian government says it's seized a town from rebels near the lebanese border as part of its efforts to block their supply lines. sebastian usher reports .

zh-CN: 叙利亚各地仍在发生战斗，有的战斗更激烈。
en-US: battles continue to rage across syria , some more significant than others .

zh-CN: 叙利亚政府要努力夺回扎拉镇，
en-US: that's certainly how the syrian government is talking up its recapture of the town of zara .

zh-CN: 因这里临近与黎巴嫩接壤处，叛军武装分子可以借此运送重要的武器和援军供应，因此对政府来说很重要。
en-US: it's important to the government because it's near the border with lebanon , from where rebel fighters run vital supply lines for weapons and reinforcements .

zh-CN: 总统阿萨德的支持者一直想阻断这里，现在可能无法做到了。
en-US: president assad's supporters are trying to block these , and may now be closed doing so .

zh-CN: 自上个月起，他们就一直在炮轰距离边境南部40公里的Yabroud。
en-US: since last month , they've been bombarding in yabroud , some 40 kilometers south along the border .

zh-CN: 对扎拉镇的轰炸可能预示着要轰炸该镇留下的居民。
en-US: the storming of zara maybe a foretaste of what's installed for that town's remaining residents .

zh-CN: 反对派活动人士称扎拉镇部分流下来的人在家中被杀。
en-US: opposition activists say some of those left in zara were killed in their homes .

zh-CN: 数千人在黎巴嫩首都贝鲁特游行要求通过保护妇女反对家暴的法律，
en-US: several thousand people have marched through the lebanese capital beirut to demand the passage of law , protecting women against domestic violence .

zh-CN: 当天正是国际妇女节。
en-US: the rally coincides with international women's day .

zh-CN: 黎巴嫩是阿拉伯国家最自由的国家之一，
en-US: lebanon is one of the most liberal countries in the arab world ,

zh-CN: 但并没有保护妇女免受父亲、丈夫或兄长暴力摧残的法律。
en-US: but there's no law protecting women from violence by their fathers , husbands or brothers .

zh-CN: 委内瑞拉数千名学生和反对派支持者在首都加拉加斯举行反政府集会，
en-US: thousands of venezuelan students and opposition supporters have gathered for an anti-government rally in the capital caracas .

zh-CN: 政府部署了数千安全部队人员，阻止游行者向食品部走去。
en-US: the government has deployed thousands of security officers to prevent a planed march towards the food ministry .

zh-CN: 总统尼古拉斯·马杜罗称已邀请各党来进行和平对话，
en-US: president nicolas maduro said all parties were invited to take part in a dialogue for peace .

zh-CN: 但反对派称要参加就必要释放北部学生。
en-US: but the opposition has said any participation will be conditional on the release of detained students .

zh-CN: 至少21人在近一个月的抗议者中丧生。
en-US: at least 21 people have been killed in nearly a month of protests .

zh-CN: 意大利敦促美国阿玛利特公司撤回一个广告，上面的图像显示米开朗基罗的大卫手持一把步枪。
en-US: italy has urged armalite in the united states to withdraw an advertisement , showing an image of michelangelo's david holding a rifle .

zh-CN: 意大利文化部长弗兰切斯基尼称除非该公司立即撤回广告，否则将诉诸法律。
en-US: the italian culture minister dario franceschini said the government would take legal action against the company unless it immediately withdraws the campaign .

zh-CN: 他说持枪大卫的形象不仅有冒犯意味，还是非法的。
en-US: he said the image of an armed david was not only offensive but also illegal .

zh-CN: 员工必须陪着上司加班吗？
en-US: when the boss works long hours , do we all have to ?

zh-CN: 题：每天晚上你想下班时，工作狂老板都还粘在电脑前。
en-US: the problem : every night , your workaholic boss is still glued to the computer when you need to leave .

zh-CN: 怎么才能下班回家又不表现得像个懒鬼？
en-US: how to go home without looking like a slacker ?

zh-CN: 你是怀着不会在大厅被上司撞见的侥幸心偷偷溜走呢？
en-US: should you sneak out , hoping to avoid a six o'clock showdown in the hall ?

zh-CN: 还是充满歉意地道歉，承诺整晚都等着收电子邮件？
en-US: guiltily apologize , promising to be on email all night ?

zh-CN: 还是以最职业的方式直接走向大门？
en-US: or just walk straight toward the door in the most professional way you can ?

zh-CN: 许多辛勤工作的员工都有一个更加辛勤工作、经常加班到深夜的老板。
en-US: many hard-working employees have an even harder-working boss who toils late into the night .

zh-CN: 职业咨询师和老员工称，最重要的是表现出你仍在辛勤工作──并且表现出色。
en-US: career coaches and employees who have been there say the first priority should be conveying that you are still working hard -- and good at your job .

zh-CN: 这需要经常明确地汇报你的工作进度和工作业绩。
en-US: that requires communicating clearly and frequently about your progress and results .

zh-CN: 最理想的做法是，弄明白上司的真正需要并持续交出满意的答卷，这样你的工作时间就不再是个问题了。
en-US: ideally , you want to figure out what the boss really needs and deliver it consistently enough that your hours become a non-issue .

zh-CN: 许多员工认为，上司青睐没日没夜工作的人，而职场趋势也证明了这个观点：根据密尔沃基的人才与职业管理公司RightManagement去年秋天对325名员工进行的一项调查，三分之二员工的工作时间多于五年前。
en-US: many employees assume managers value people for working day and night , and workplace trends support that belief : two-thirds of workers are putting in much longer hours on the job than five years ago , according to a poll of 325 employees last fall by right management , milwaukee , a talent and career-management company .

zh-CN: 但新泽西州麦迪逊的培训与咨询公司Flex+StrategyGroup的首席执行长卡利·威廉斯·约斯特说，在你过度关注工作时间之前，请确认上司真正的期望。
en-US: but before you get too hung up on work hours , check your assumptions about what the boss wants , says cali williams yost , chief executive officer of flex + strategy group , a madison , n.j. , training and consulting firm .

zh-CN: 上司加班有各种原因：可能是个人习惯或偏好，也可能只是因为他们不想回家。
en-US: managers work long hours for a variety of reasons : it may be a personal habit or preference , or perhaps they just don't want to go home .

zh-CN: 约斯特说：“人们对上司期望的许多猜测都是错的。”
en-US: ' people make way too many guesses about managers' expectations that are just wrong , ' ms. yost says .

zh-CN: 上司们常常惊讶于员工对他们工作时间的关注。
en-US: bosses are often taken aback by employees' focus on their schedules .

zh-CN: 软件开发公司ThoughtWorks的亚特兰大区域总经理贝蒂·埃约纳姆·库马霍经常每天工作14小时，通过电子邮件和电话与分处世界各地的其他人保持联系。
en-US: betty enyonam kumahor often works 14-hour days , emailing and calling contacts around the world . ' my teams started tracking how many hours they thought i slept each night , based on my email 'send' times , ' says ms. kumahor , a regional managing director in atlanta for thoughtworks , a software-development company .

zh-CN: 她说：“我手下的各个团队开始根据我的电子邮件‘发送’时间猜测我每晚睡多少小时。他们开玩笑地问我：‘你睡觉吗？’”她向员工保证不会再频频在深夜或凌晨发送电子邮件，这样他们就不必熬夜等着回复她了。
en-US: ' they asked me jokingly , ' do you ever sleep ? ' ' she assured employees she would stop sending so many late-night and early-morning emails so they didn't have to extend their hours to respond .

zh-CN: 约斯特说，上司关注员工的工作时间，往往是为了保证其他方面的需要：比如，下属能在最后期限前完成工作，他们可以在需要时随叫随到，他们不会给同事增加额外工作，等等。
en-US: when managers focus on employees' work hours , they are often looking for reassurance on other fronts : that their subordinates are meeting deadlines ; that they can be reached when needed , and that they aren't creating extra work for colleagues , ms. yost says .

zh-CN: 康涅狄格州斯坦福德(Stamford)的高管培训师里奇·吉说，在以前的一份工作中，上司曾把他叫到一边，批评他下午五点就下班。
en-US: rich gee's boss on a former job took him aside and criticized him for leaving the office at 5 p.m. , says mr. gee , a stamford , conn. , executive coach .

zh-CN: 这位上司承认，吉在最后期限前完成了工作并且表现出色，他早上6:30就到了办公室，比同事早两个小时。
en-US: the manager acknowledged that mr. gee was meeting deadlines and delivering good work ; he arrived at the office at 6:30 a.m. , two hours before his co-workers .

zh-CN: 但是，上司似乎担心吉不能在需要时随叫随到。
en-US: the boss seemed nervous , however , that mr. gee wouldn't be available when needed .

zh-CN: 吉说，随时都可以打电话找到他，并指出他对紧急要求的反应一直很迅速。
en-US: mr. gee said he could be reached 24/7 by cellphone , and pointed out that he always responded quickly to emergency requests .

zh-CN: 他仍然在下午五点下班，但经常向上司汇报工作进展和工作业绩，而且每晚下班前都会知会一声。
en-US: he continued to leave the office at 5 p.m. , but updated his boss often on his progress and results and checked in every evening before he left .

zh-CN: 他说，他的上司终于“发现工作时间并不重要──重要的是我工作有多努力”。
en-US: in time , he says , his boss 'saw that it wasn't hours that mattered -- it was how hard i worked . '

zh-CN: 吉的解决方案的一个关键是：健康的沟通。
en-US: one key to mr. gee's solution : healthy communication .

zh-CN: 咨询公司WorkOptions的老板、夏威夷卡内奥赫(Kaneohe)的帕特·凯特普(PatKatepoo)说，员工应该和上司一起坐下来，请他们明确工作目标和完成期限，然后“寻找汇报工作进展的合适时间，可以是开员工会议时，也可以是和上司碰面时或者是通过电子邮件”。
en-US: employees should sit down with their bosses and ask them to define job objectives and time lines for reaching them , says pat katepoo , the kaneohe , hawaii-based owner of workoptions , a consulting firm. then 'look for natural times to communicate about your progress , when you have a staff meeting or you ' re walking by or writing an email , ' says ms. katepoo .

zh-CN: 给上司留下努力工作的印象有许多方法。
en-US: there are many ways to project a hard-working image .

zh-CN: 密苏里州堪萨斯城的广告业高管安妮·布朗说，如果上司热情而专注地谈论某个项目，那么就以同样程度的热情作答，承认其重要性并重复最后期限。她在一本叫《职场成功之路》的书中以及她与别人共同创建的网站GradtoGreat上写到了年轻员工如何应对工作狂上司。
en-US: if a manager speaks about a project in an intense , focused way , answer with similar intensity , acknowledging its importance and repeating the deadline , says anne brown , an advertising executive who has written about how young employees can deal with workaholic bosses in a book , ' grad to great , ' and on a website she co-founded , gradtogreat .

zh-CN: 布朗补充道，在一对一会议中应该掌握好时间，快速完成议程。当然，在紧要关头或旺季时节，或重大项目的最后期限临近时也应该做好加班准备。
en-US: manage time well in one-on-one meetings , moving quickly through your agenda , adds ms. brown , of kansas city , mo. and , of course , be prepared to work long hours during a crisis or busy season , or when a major project deadline is looming .

zh-CN: 在某些情况下，变更工作时段也是一种方法。
en-US: in some cases , shifting your work hours can help .

zh-CN: 在上司关注员工露面时间的公司中，上午10点到晚上八点工作的员工──多数人上班的时间──比上午七点到下午五点工作的员工更容易得到注意。
en-US: at companies where managers focus on face time , employees who work 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. -- when more people are present -- are more likely to get noticed than those who work 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.

zh-CN: 纽约NextStepPartners的高管培训师迈克尔·梅尔彻说，以前在一家投资银行工作时，曾被告知“我的工作时间不够长，我开始晚到并工作到更晚。
en-US: executive coach michael melcher was told in a previous job at an investment bank that 'i wasn't working long enough hours , ' he says. 'i started coming in later and staying later , ' he says .

zh-CN: 几个月后，我的上司说：‘我注意到你的工作时间变长了。’”
en-US: ' a couple of months later , my boss said , ' it hasn't gone unnoticed that you ' re putting in additional hours.' '

zh-CN: 不过，伪造在上班的假象是行不通的。
en-US: faking a presence at the office , however , doesn't work .

zh-CN: 约斯特说，将外套扔在椅子上，好像你在上班、只不过离开一小会儿，其效果只会事与愿违。
en-US: throwing your coat over your chair as if you just stepped away , then leaving for the day , is likely to backfire , ms. yost says .

zh-CN: 同事们可能会“认为你在，并疯了样地到处找你”。
en-US: colleagues will ' think you ' re there and run around like crazy people trying to find you . '

zh-CN: 梅尔彻说，另一个不可取的做法是“爱发牢骚，总是唉声叹气，说你已经忙得四脚朝天了。没人想听这种话”。
en-US: another nonstarter , says mr. melcher , an executive coach with next step partners , new york , is 'being a whiny complainer , with a lot of exasperated sighs , saying you ' re working your fingers to the bone. nobody wants to hear that . '

zh-CN: 在某些行业，加班是不可避免的。
en-US: in some professions , working long hours is unavoidable .

zh-CN: 费城职业与私人培训师朱莉·科恩说，某些公司的文化鼓励新人激烈竞争和加班。
en-US: certain firms' cultures breed intense competition and long hours among new hires , says julie cohen , a philadelphia career and personal coach .

zh-CN: 还有些公司有不成文的企业文化，例如“上司下班前大家都不能下班”。
en-US: others have unwritten cultural rules , such as , ' nobody leaves the office before the boss leaves , ' she says .

zh-CN: 科恩说，明智的做法是，至少在六个月中证明自己胜任这份工作，并在希望缩短工作时间之前征求导师的建议。
en-US: it is wise to prove yourself on the job for at least six months and ask a mentor for advice before exploring shorter hours , ms. cohen says .

zh-CN: “如果你不了解公司的规则，可能会踏入雷区。”
en-US: ' you might be stepping into a minefield if you don't understand the ins and outs of the organization . '

zh-CN: 梅尔彻说，为了在关于工作时间的协商中争取最有利的结果，不妨提前考虑上司的需要，并提供证明自己工作业绩的详细资料。
en-US: to get the most out of a negotiation about hours , mr. melcher says , think in advance about the boss's needs , and bring specifics documenting your own performance .

zh-CN: 你可以从一张措辞积极、谈论进展顺利工作的字条开始。
en-US: start on a positive note , talking about what's going well .

zh-CN: 也可以询问上司对员工工作时间和回复邮件时间的期望。
en-US: ask what the boss expects of employees when it comes to work hours and responding to email .

zh-CN: 梅尔彻推荐的解决方法是“是的……
en-US: to propose solutions , mr. melcher recommends the 'yes . . .

zh-CN: 然后”技巧：肯定上司的观点，然后阐述你自己的观点。
en-US: and' technique : affirm the boss's point , and then state your own .

zh-CN: 例如：“是的，我希望您在下班后也能找到我。然后我有两个双胞胎小孩，下午5:30到晚上8:00这段时间在家与家人度过对我来说很重要。我可以在晚上9:00到11:00处理工作。这样如何？”
en-US: for example : ' yes , i want you to be able to rely on me after hours. and since i have young twins , it is important to me to be home between 5:30 p.m. and 8 p.m. and spend that time with family . i could respond to you between 9 p.m. and 11 p.m. how does that sound ? '

zh-CN: 这样的谈话可以开启意见交换──也可能会碰壁。
en-US: such conversations can open a dialogue - - or expose a brick wall .

zh-CN: 项目经理阿珊提·斯坦福说，她在以前的一份工作中跟上司提出这个问题时，那位上司转转眼珠，叹了口气，说道：“我的想法是，‘既然我得在这些时间加班，你还抱怨什么呢？’”在那之后，斯坦福换了个上班时间更合适的工作。
en-US: when project manager ashanti stanford raised the issue with a boss at a previous job , the manager rolled her eyes and sighed . ' the expectation was , ' i have to work these hours , so why are you complaining ? ' ' ms. stanford says. she has since moved on to a job with better hours .

zh-CN: 一直以来，人们都认为，一个幽默的男人能让女人开心，把女人哄上床，不论他相貌如何。
en-US: it has long been said that a man with a good sense of humour can laugh a woman in to bed , despite his looks .

zh-CN: 现在研究人员认为，也许反过来说也是对的——研究发现，长得帅的男人更风趣。
en-US: now researchers believe the opposite may also be true - that we also find attractive members of the opposite sex more amusing .

zh-CN: 英国斯特灵大学的心理学家发现，当人们可以看到讲话者的面容（好看与否）时，长得好看的讲话者给人感觉更幽默。
en-US: psychologists at the university of stirling have discovered that good-looking people were perceived as funnier when the people listening to them could see what they looked like - i.e. whether they were attractive or not .

zh-CN: 在这一研究中，研究人员让一些心理学专业本科在读的学生回答将把哪两种东西带到荒岛上，并说出理由。
en-US: in the study , undergraduate psychology students were videoed while being asked which two items they would take to a desert island , and why .

zh-CN: 他们可以从巧克力、发胶或塑料袋里面选，整个问答过程都录成了视频。
en-US: they could pick from either chocolate , hairspray or a plastic bag .

zh-CN: 虽然研究人员没有告诉学生这一研究和幽默有关，但绝大部分学生看起来都努力想让自己的答案显得有趣。
en-US: while the students weren't told that the study was about humour , the vast majority gave the appearance of trying to be funny in their answers .

zh-CN: 其他一部分学生被要求给这些荒岛题回答的幽默感，以及各个应答者在短期或长期恋爱关系中的魅力指数打分。
en-US: other students were then asked to rate the desert-island comments for wit , as well as how attractive each of the commenters might be for a short-term or long-term relationship .

zh-CN: 研究人员发现，长得好看的人在视频中的表现被认为比长相平凡的人更有趣。
en-US: the researchers found that attractive individuals were rated as funnier in video clips than their less dashing counterparts .

zh-CN: 研究人员还发现，风趣的男人被认为在短暂恋情中最有魅力。
en-US: funnier men were also considered most attractive for a fling , the researchers found .

zh-CN: 这也许是因为风趣的外表会给人对待感情不认真或不愿意对长期感情关系负责的印象。
en-US: this might be because wit may give off the impression of not being serious or willing to commit to a long-term relationship .

zh-CN: 问答过程被录成视频也对结果产生了很大影响。
en-US: being recorded on video also made a real difference .

zh-CN: 一般来说，那些被录像的男人比那些只录下声音、提供个人照片的男人给人感觉更幽默。
en-US: men who were videoed were generally considered more amusing than those who only had their voices recorded and provided a photo of themselves .

zh-CN: 研究人员提出的一个理论是，男人尤其喜欢把幽默作为一个交配信号来向女人展示自己的才智和优良基因。
en-US: one theory is that men , in particular , use humour as a mating signal , to show-off their intelligence and good genes to women .

zh-CN: 另一个理论是，男人用风趣的谈吐来表明自己被异性吸引。
en-US: another is that we use wit to indicate we are sexually attracted to people .

zh-CN: 该研究发表在《个性与个体差异》杂志上。
en-US: the study was published in the journal personality and individual differences .

zh-CN: 华为成国际专利流氓10大攻击目标之一
en-US: 10 biggest patent troll targets in business

zh-CN: 2013年，无线运营商美国电话电报公司AT&T成为了“专利流氓”的首要攻击目标。一年之内，AT&T被这类公司起诉达54次，平均下来每周超过一次。
en-US: wireless carrier at&t ( t ) was the top target of so-called patent trolls in 2013 , having been sued more than 54 times by them in 2013 — more than once a week .

zh-CN: 今天，《财富》杂志在一篇关于专利集成公司RPXCorp的专题报道中公布了这家公司统计、编撰的2014年“专利流氓十大目标公司”名单。
en-US: this year's list of top ten patent troll targets was published today in a fortune magazine feature story about rpx corp. ( rpxc ) , which compiled the statistics .

zh-CN: 这篇标题为《迎接魔头的挑战》写道：“AT&T并不是一个特例。谷歌公司去年被起诉达43次，威瑞森通信被起诉42次，苹果公司被起诉41次，三星和亚马逊分别被起诉39次，戴尔索尼分别被起诉34次，华为32次，黑莓公司31次。进入这张榜单并不是一件令人羡慕的事，榜单中的这些公司至少12天就要被（专利流氓）起诉一次。”
en-US: the article , called " taking on the trolls , " states : " at&t is no anomaly . google ( goog ) was hit with 43 [ such ] suits last year ; verizon ( vz ) , 42 ; apple ( aapl ) , 41 ; samsung ( ssnlf ) and amazon ( amzn ) , 39 each ; dell and sony ( sne ) , 34 each ; huawei , 32 ; blackberry ( bbry ) , 31. every brand on this unenviable top-ten list was sued by [ a patent troll ] at least once every 12 days. "

zh-CN: “专利流氓”这个称呼带有鄙夷的意味。
en-US: " patent troll " is a pejorative term .

zh-CN: “专利流氓”这个称呼带有鄙夷的意味。
en-US: a more neutral term , and the one that rpx uses , is " non-practicing entity , " or npe .

zh-CN: NPE公司本身不为他人提供任何产品或服务。
en-US: an npe is a company that sells no products or services of its own .

zh-CN: 它们最具争议的做法是，在公开市场上购买各种专利，然后声称运营公司（比如AT&T或谷歌）使用了他们的专利，然后要求对方支付授权费。NPE拿到授权费的方式通常是向这些公司发起法律诉讼。
en-US: in their most controversial form , npes purchase patents on the open market and then assert them against operating companies , like at&t and google , seeking licensing fees and , often , suing to get them .

zh-CN: RPX则是所谓的防御型专利集成公司。
en-US: rpx is what's known as a defensive patent aggregator .

zh-CN: RPX向公司收取会员费，然后赶在NPE动手之前，抢先买下公开市场上对成员公司具有潜在隐患的专利。目前RPX共有约168家客户，其中包括谷歌、威瑞森通信和三星。
en-US: in exchange for a subscription fee — currently paid by some 168 companies , including google , verizon , and samsung — it attempts to buy up potentially problematic patents on the open market , before npes can get their hands on them .

zh-CN: 学术及政府机构均仰仗RPX提供的统计数据。2013年，NPE共提起了3,608起诉讼，比2012年的3,042件增加了19%。这些诉讼指向的被告共有4,843名，比2012年的4,282名增加了13%。
en-US: according to rpx's statistics — which have been relied upon by academics and government agencies — npes filed 3,608 new suits in 2013 , up 19% from the 3,042 they filed in 20 12 , and their suits named 4,843 total defendants , up 13% from the 4,282 sued a year earlier .

zh-CN: 根据它向《财富》杂志提供的资料，NPE提起的案件占去年全部专利案件的67%，被告人数为总被告人数的63%。
en-US: npe suits accounted for 67% of all new patent cases filed last year , and 63% of all new patent defendants , according to the figures rpx shared with fortune .

zh-CN: （2）小说测试集。
en-US: ( 2 ) novel test data .

zh-CN: 店铺里的怪物
en-US: the creature in the shop

zh-CN: 我是弗雷德里克·特里维斯博士，伦敦医院的医生。
en-US: my name is dr frederick treves. i am a doctor at the london hospital .

zh-CN: 1884年的一天，我在医院附近一家店铺的橱窗里看见了一张照片。
en-US: one day in 1884 , i saw a picture in the window of a shop near the hospital .

zh-CN: 我停下来，看着这张照片。
en-US: i stopped in front of the shop and looked at the picture .

zh-CN: 起先我觉得这张照片挺有趣，后来就感到生气、害怕起来。
en-US: at first i felt interested , then i felt angry , then afraid .

zh-CN: 照片上有个男人，但不像你和我。
en-US: there was a man in the picture , but he did not look like you and me .

zh-CN: 他看上去不像个人，而像一头大象。
en-US: he did not look like a man . he looked like an elephant .

zh-CN: 我看了看照片下面的文字，上面写着：进来吧，看看这个象人，一次两便士。
en-US: i read the writing under the picture. it said ： come in and see the elephant man. 2 pence .

zh-CN: 我推开门走了进去。
en-US: i opened the door and went in .

zh-CN: 店里有个男人，穿着一件旧外套，嘴里叼着一支烟。
en-US: there was a man in the shop. he was a dirty man in an old coat with a cigarette in his mouth .

zh-CN: “你想干什么？”他问道。
en-US: ‘ what do you want ？ ’ he asked .

zh-CN: “我想看看象人。”我说。
en-US: ‘ i'd like to see the elephant man , please , ’ i said .

zh-CN: 这个人生气地看着我。
en-US: the man looked at me angrily .

zh-CN: “不行。”他说，“店铺现在关门了，你明天来吧。”
en-US: ‘ well , you can't , ’ he said . ‘ the shop's closing now. you can come back tomorrow . ’

zh-CN: “对不起，”我说，“我想现在就看，明天我没有空，我有许多事情要做，我可以另外多给一些钱。”
en-US: ‘ i'm sorry , ’ i said . ‘ but i would like to see him now. i have no time tomorrow — i have a lot of work to do. but i can give you more than 2 pence . ’

zh-CN: 这个人仔细地打量着我，后来他取下嘴里的烟卷，露出了满嘴黄牙。
en-US: the man looked at me carefully . then he took the cigarette out of his mouth and smiled with his yellow teeth .

zh-CN: 他说，“好吧，先生。就给十二便士吧。”
en-US: ‘ all right , sir , ’he said . ‘ give me twelve pence then . ’

zh-CN: 我把钱给了他，他就打开了店铺后门。
en-US: i gave him the money and he opened a door at the back of the shop .

zh-CN: 我们走进一个小房间，房间又冷又暗，里面一股恶心的气味。
en-US: we went into a little room . the room was cold and dark , and there was a horrible smell in it .

zh-CN: 一个怪物坐在桌子后面的椅子上。
en-US: a creature sat on a chair behind a table .

zh-CN: 我说那是一个怪物，它不像你和我，不是男人也不是女人。
en-US: i say a creature , because it was not a man or a woman , like you or me .

zh-CN: 它一动不动地坐在这间又冷又暗又脏的房间里的椅子上，眼睛盯着桌子，由于阴冷，这个怪物的头上盖着一块布，在他面前的桌子上放着一朵枯萎的花。
en-US: the creature did not move or look at us. it sat very quietly on the chair in the cold , dark , dirty room , and looked at the table. on the table in front of it , there was a dead flower .

zh-CN: “站起来，”店老板大声地说。
en-US: ‘ stand up ! ’ said the shopkeeper , loudly .

zh-CN: 怪物慢慢地站起来，取下头上的盖布放在椅子上。
en-US: the creature stood up slowly . it took the old cloth off its head , and put it on the chair .

zh-CN: 看着这个怪物，我感到很悲伤。
en-US: i looked at the creature and felt sad .

zh-CN: 我是一个医生，我很了解事故和病人。
en-US: i am a doctor , so i know a lot about accidents and ill people .

zh-CN: 我每天要遇到许多可怕的、丑恶的东西，可这个怪物却是最糟糕的。
en-US: i see horrible , ugly things every day. but this creature , this thing , was the worst of all .

zh-CN: 医院里没有任何一个男人或女人像他这个样子。
en-US: there were no men or women in the hospital like him .

zh-CN: 他穿着条旧裤子，没有穿衬衫、外套和鞋子。所以，我可以清楚地看见他的身体。
en-US: he wore some old trousers , but no shirt , coat , or shoes , so i could see his body very well .

zh-CN: 他的头部最有趣，长得很大很大，就像一个装着许多书籍的大口袋。
en-US: his head was the most interesting thing. it was very , very big— like an enormous bag with a lot of books in it .

zh-CN: 头上头发不多，脑后还耷拉着一块褐色的、肮脏的头皮，一直垂到脖子下面。
en-US: the head did not have much hair , and there was another bag of brown , dirty skin at the back of it. this skin came down below his neck .

zh-CN: 我看不见他的一只眼睛，因为皮肤也从脸部垂下来。
en-US: i could not see one of his eyes very well , because a lot of skin came down in front of his face , too .

zh-CN: 一颗巨大的红牙齿从嘴里露出来，就像一颗象牙，嘴和鼻子就像脸上开的洞，从他脸上看不出微笑还是大笑，也看不出生气和悲伤，因为这种皮肤无法活动，它已经失去活力，像一只大象的脸。
en-US: an enormous red tooth came out of his mouth , under his nose. it looked like an elephant's tooth. the mouth and nose were like holes in the face. the face could not smile or laugh or look angry or sad , because the skin could not move. it was dead , like an elephant's face .

zh-CN: 这个怪物身体的前胸和后背的脏皮肤上有许多囊肿，这种囊肿<包状物>一直拖到他的腿部。
en-US: there were more bags of dirty skin on the front and back of the creature's body. these bags came down to his legs .

zh-CN: 右臂巨大，皮肤上也有包状物，右手像男人的脚。
en-US: the right arm was enormous , and there were bags of skin on it , too. the right hand was like a man's foot .

zh-CN: 然而左手——左臂和左手——却是长得很美，左臂上有漂亮的皮肤，左指头纤长、美丽，就像年轻女人的手一样。
en-US: but the left hand the left arm and the left hand were beautiful ! the left arm had wonderful skin , and the fingers of the left hand were long and beautiful. it was like a young woman's hand !

zh-CN: “走一走，麦里克！”店老板生气地说，“朝前走，动一动，快！”
en-US: ‘ walk , merrick ! ’ said the shopkeeper angrily . ‘ come on , quickly , move ! ’

zh-CN: 他用手打着这个怪物。
en-US: he hit the creature with his hand .

zh-CN: 慢慢地，这个怪物走到房间的对面。
en-US: slowly , the creature walked across the room .

zh-CN: 可他走不好，他的腿又粗又肥，背部有病，没有拐杖走不远。
en-US: but he could not walk well . his legs were very big and fat , and he had a bad back. he could not walk far without a stick .

zh-CN: “好了，谢谢你，”我说，“让他坐下来，我不想再看什么了。”
en-US: ‘ all right , thank you , ’ i said . ‘ let him sit down. i don't want to see any more . ’

zh-CN: 我感到恶心，房间里的气味难闻极了。
en-US: i felt ill , and the smell in the room was very bad .

zh-CN: “好的，先生，”店老板说着。“坐下，麦里克。”
en-US: ‘ yes , sir , ’ said the shopkeeper . ‘ sit down , merrick . ’

zh-CN: 我们走出房间，关上门。
en-US: we went out of the room and closed the door .

en-US: we should convince the various minority nationality people that , politically , all nationalities within china's boundaries are truly equal , that their living standards can be improved and that their cultural level can be raised .
